summary.en: Grayness means the state of being gray, and it can also describe dullness or unclear/ambiguous situations.
summary.zh: Grayness指“灰色的状态”，也可引申为“沉闷乏味”或“含糊不清/灰色地带”。

definition.en: The quality or state of being gray in color; a gray appearance.
definition.zh: 灰色的性质或状态；灰色的外观。

examples.en: The grayness of the sky made the afternoon feel colder.
examples.zh: 天空的灰暗让下午感觉更冷了。

examples.en: In winter, the grayness of the streets can feel a bit depressing.
examples.zh: 冬天街道的灰蒙蒙有时会让人有点沮丧。

definition.en: A dull, unclear, or less lively quality (often describing mood, writing, or atmosphere).
definition.zh: 乏味、模糊或缺少活力的特质（常形容心情、文字或氛围）。

examples.en: There was a grayness in his voice after the bad news.
examples.zh: 听到坏消息后，他的声音里带着一种灰沉。

examples.en: Try to add details to avoid the grayness of general statements.
examples.zh: 尽量加一些细节，避免笼统说法带来的乏味感。

definition.en: A state of uncertainty or moral ambiguity; a “gray area.”
definition.zh: 不确定或道德上暧昧不明的状态；“灰色地带”。

examples.en: The rules leave some grayness about what is allowed.
examples.zh: 这些规则对什么是允许的留下了一些不明确之处。

examples.en: The story explores the grayness between right and wrong.
examples.zh: 这个故事探讨了对与错之间的灰色地带。

extraExplanation: “grayness”来自形容词“gray”加名词后缀“-ness”，表示“……的状态/性质”。因此它既能指颜色层面的“灰”，也常引申为情绪上的“阴郁”、表达上的“单调”，或判断上的“模糊不清”。
在文学和评论写作里，“grayness”常用来营造氛围（如阴天、城市冬景），或表达道德复杂性（接近“ambiguity / a gray area”）。

summary.en: “Graynesses” means multiple instances or kinds of grayness—either literal gray color or a figurative sense of dullness/gloom.
summary.zh: “graynesses”指多种/多处“灰意”：既可指字面上的灰色（灰度），也可指引申的沉闷、阴郁或不明朗。

definition.en: plural of grayness: the qualities or states of being gray (having a gray color), or of seeming dull, gloomy, or unclear.
definition.zh: grayness 的复数：指“灰色的状态/性质”，也可指“沉闷、阴郁或不明朗”的感觉。

examples.en: In winter, the graynesses of the sky and sea made the town feel quiet.
examples.zh: 冬天里，天空和海面的层层灰意让小镇显得格外安静。

examples.en: The photo captures many graynesses—from pale silver to dark charcoal.
examples.zh: 这张照片捕捉到了多种灰度——从浅银灰到深炭灰。

examples.en: After the bad news, a few emotional graynesses hung over the room.
examples.zh: 坏消息之后，屋里笼罩着几分情绪上的阴郁。

extraExplanation: “graynesses”在日常英语中不算常见；更常用的说法是用不可数名词“grayness”（the grayness of the sky）或用“shades/tones of gray（不同的灰色调）”。
美式拼写通常是“gray”，英式常见“grey”；两者意思相同。

summary.en: Grayout usually means a temporary dimming/greying of vision (often from reduced blood flow), and it can also mean making an image look washed out or (less commonly) partial information suppression.
summary.zh: Grayout 通常指因供血不足导致的短暂“灰视”（视野变暗发灰）；也可指使画面变灰/褪色，较少见地指对信息的部分性压制。

definition.en: A partial loss of vision in which things look dim or gray, often caused by reduced blood flow to the eyes/brain (for example during high G-forces, standing up too fast, or low blood pressure).
definition.zh: （视觉）灰视：视野变暗、发灰的现象，常因大脑/眼部供血不足引起（如承受高重力加速度、起身过快或低血压）。

examples.en: The pilot reported a brief grayout during the tight turn.
examples.zh: 飞行员报告在急转弯时出现了短暂的灰视。

examples.en: When I stood up too quickly, I felt dizzy and had a momentary grayout.
examples.zh: 我起身太快时感到头晕，并短暂出现了灰视。

definition.en: To make something appear gray or less vivid; to dim or wash out (often used in technical or medical contexts).
definition.zh: 使变灰；使变暗、褪色（常用于技术或医学语境）。

examples.en: High glare can gray out the image on the screen.
examples.zh: 强烈眩光会让屏幕上的画面变灰、变得不清晰。

examples.en: The medication may briefly gray out your vision.
examples.zh: 这种药物可能会让你的视野短暂发灰变暗。

definition.en: A temporary restriction or suppression of information (less common; sometimes used alongside “blackout,” especially in discussions of media or censorship).
definition.zh: （较少见）信息的暂时限制或压制（有时与 blackout 并用，用于媒体或审查讨论）。

examples.en: They accused the authorities of a news grayout rather than a total blackout.
examples.zh: 他们指责当局对新闻进行了“灰化”式限制，而不是彻底封锁。

extraExplanation: “Grayout / greyout”在航空与人体生理中很常见：通常先出现灰视（视野变暗发灰），再严重可能发展为“blackout”（短暂失明/意识丧失）。
拼写上美式更常见 gray-out / grayout，英式常见 grey-out / greyout；写成带连字符的 gray-out 在正式写作中也很常见。

summary.en: “Grayouts” most often means UI options shown in gray because they’re unavailable; it can also mean brief episodes of dimmed vision (gray-outs).
summary.zh: “grayouts”最常指界面中因不可用而显示为灰色的选项；也可指短暂的视野变暗（gray-out）。

definition.en: (Computing/UI) Disabled menu items, buttons, or options shown in a light gray color to indicate they are not available right now.
definition.zh: （计算机/界面）“变灰”的选项、按钮或菜单项；用浅灰色显示，表示当前不可用。

examples.en: The grayouts in the settings menu mean you don’t have permission to change those options.
examples.zh: 设置菜单里那些变灰的选项表示你没有权限修改。

examples.en: After you select ‘Guest mode,’ you’ll see several grayouts in the account section.
examples.zh: 选择“访客模式”后，你会看到账号部分有好几个选项变灰。

definition.en: (Medicine/aviation) Brief partial loss or dimming of vision (often from low blood flow to the eyes/brain), sometimes before fainting; plural of “gray-out.”
definition.zh: （医学/航空）短暂的部分视力下降或视野变暗（常因大脑/眼部供血不足），有时是昏厥前兆；“gray-out”的复数。

examples.en: The pilot reported grayouts during the high‑G turn.
examples.zh: 飞行员报告在高过载转弯时出现视野变暗。

examples.en: If you keep having grayouts when you stand up, talk to a doctor.
examples.zh: 如果你一站起来就经常眼前发黑，建议咨询医生。

extraExplanation: 在软件界面里，“grayout”通常是名词，指“被置灰的控件/选项”；也常见作动词短语“gray out”（把某个选项置灰，使其不可用）。英式拼写常写作“grey-out/greying out”。
医学/航空语境中的“gray-out”与“blackout（眼前一黑/失去意识）”相关，但程度更轻：通常是先视野变暗、对比度下降，严重时才可能发展为完全昏厥。

summary.en: Graypate is an old-fashioned word for a gray-haired person (often an older man) or something described as gray-haired.
summary.zh: graypate 是较古旧的词，指白发的人（常指老人，尤指男性），也可作形容词表示“白发的”。

definition.en: an old person (especially a man) with gray hair; a gray-haired head
definition.zh: 灰白头发的人（尤指男性）；白发的头（带一点戏谑/文学色彩）

examples.en: The village elders, a few graypates among them, met to decide the matter.
examples.zh: 村里的长者们聚在一起商议此事，其中有几位白发老人。

examples.en: In the old tale, the brave youth ignores the warning of a graypate and rushes into the forest.
examples.zh: 在那则古老的故事里，勇敢的年轻人无视白发老人的警告，冲进了森林。

definition.en: having a gray head; gray-haired (used as a descriptive word in older literature)
definition.zh: 灰白头发的；白发的（多见于旧文学中的描写）

examples.en: A graypate sailor leaned on the rail and watched the storm.
examples.zh: 一位白发水手倚着栏杆看风暴。

extraExplanation: 这是一个偏古旧、带文学/戏谑色彩的词：gray（灰白的）+ pate（头顶/头）。现代英语更常用 gray-haired、elderly man、old-timer、old man 等。
pate 这个词本义是“头顶/脑袋”，在口语里不算常见，更多见于固定表达或较旧的文本。

summary.en: “Grays” most often means multiple shades of gray, or gray hairs; it can also be the verb form meaning “becomes/makes gray.”
summary.zh: “grays”通常指多种灰色/灰调，或指灰白头发；也可作动词，表示“变灰/使变灰”。

definition.en: Plural of gray: shades or colors between black and white; also gray-colored things (often hair).
definition.zh: gray（灰色）的复数：指介于黑与白之间的各种灰色；也可指灰色的事物（常指灰白头发）。

examples.en: The painting uses soft grays and blues to create a calm mood.
examples.zh: 这幅画用柔和的灰色和蓝色来营造平静的氛围。

examples.en: In the winter light, the city turns into a world of grays.
examples.zh: 在冬日的光线里，城市变成了一片灰色的世界。

examples.en: He noticed a few grays in his hair.
examples.zh: 他注意到自己头发里多了几根白发。

definition.en: Third-person singular of gray: to become gray, or to make something look gray (often used for hair, sky, photos).
definition.zh: gray 的第三人称单数：变灰；使……呈灰色（常用于头发、天空、照片等）。

examples.en: His beard grays a little more every year.
examples.zh: 他的胡子每年都会更白一些。

examples.en: Smoke grays the sky above the hills.
examples.zh: 烟雾让山丘上方的天空变得灰蒙蒙的。

extraExplanation: 拼写小贴士：美式英语更常用 gray，英式英语更常用 grey；两者意思相同。

summary.en: “graysbies” is not a standard English word; it’s likely a name or a misspelling.
summary.zh: “graysbies”不是标准英语词；更可能是人名/姓氏或拼写错误。

definition.en: A nonstandard/rare spelling that is not recognized as a common English word; it may be intended as a proper name (a surname) or a misspelling of another word.
definition.zh: 一种非标准/罕见拼写，通常不被当作常见英语单词；可能是专有名词（姓氏）或其他词的拼写错误。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “graysbies” in a standard dictionary—could it be a last name or a typo?
examples.zh: 我在常见词典里找不到“graysbies”——它会不会是姓氏或拼写错误？

examples.en: If you meant “Grimsbys” or “Graysbys,” the meaning would depend on the specific place or family name.
examples.zh: 如果你想写的是“Grimsbys”或“Graysbys”，含义就要看具体的地名或家族姓氏。

extraExplanation:
“graysbies”不是常见英语词汇。最可能的情况是：
1）你在写人名/姓氏（如 Graysby/Graysbie 的复数或变体）；
2）你想写别的词但拼错了（例如某个地名或姓氏）。
如果你告诉我它出现的句子或你想表达的意思，我可以帮你定位最可能的正确拼法与含义。

summary.en: “Graysby” is usually a name (surname), not a common English vocabulary word.
summary.zh: “Graysby”通常是人名（姓氏），不是常见的英语词汇单词。

definition.en: a proper noun (most often a surname); not a standard dictionary word in modern English
definition.zh: 专有名词（多作姓氏）；不是现代英语里常见的词汇性单词

examples.en: Dr. Graysby will lead the workshop today.
examples.zh: Graysby 博士今天将带领这场工作坊。

examples.en: I saw the name “Graysby” on the mail box.
examples.zh: 我在邮箱上看到了“Graysby”这个名字。

extraExplanation: “Graysby”在通用英语词典里通常不会作为普通词条出现，更常见的是人名/姓氏（也可能是地名或品牌名）。如果你是在阅读或听力里遇到它，建议核对上下文：它指的是某个人、某个地点，还是某个公司/作品名。
它的拼写也可能是你想查的词的误拼。常见的相近拼写有：Grigsby（较常见的姓）、Gatsby（如《The Great Gatsby》里的 Gatsby）、grasp（“理解/抓住”）等。你可以告诉我句子原文，我能帮你判断更可能是哪一个。

summary.en: “Grayscale” means a black-to-white range of gray shades, or something shown using only those shades (no color).
summary.zh: “Grayscale”指从黑到白的灰阶范围，也指只用灰阶显示（不含彩色）的图像/风格。

definition.en: A range of shades from black to white (without color), often used in photos, printing, and design.
definition.zh: 从黑到白的一系列灰阶（不含彩色），常用于照片、印刷与设计。

examples.en: This photo looks more dramatic in grayscale.
examples.zh: 这张照片用灰阶呈现更有戏剧感。

examples.en: Print the document in grayscale to save color ink.
examples.zh: 用灰阶打印这份文件可以节省彩色墨水。

definition.en: Having only shades of gray; without color.
definition.zh: 灰阶的；只有灰色深浅变化的；无彩色的。

examples.en: The app can turn your pictures into grayscale images.
examples.zh: 这个应用可以把你的照片变成灰阶图像。

examples.en: She chose a grayscale background for a clean, modern look.
examples.zh: 她选了灰阶背景来营造干净、现代的感觉。

extraExplanation: 在数码影像里，grayscale 通常指“用亮度（luminance）来表示明暗”的图像模式；常见于黑白摄影、扫描文档、电子墨水屏等。
日常口语里，人们有时会把 grayscale 和 black-and-white（黑白）混用；但严格说 grayscale 强调“有很多层次的灰”，而 black-and-white 更强调“只有黑与白的对比”。

summary.en: Graywacke is a hard, dark, coarse sandstone made from mixed grains and rock fragments, common in deep-marine deposits.
summary.zh: graywacke 指杂砂岩：一种坚硬、色深、成分混杂的粗砂岩，常见于深海沉积环境。

definition.en: A hard, dark, coarse sandstone made of a mix of rock fragments, sand, and clay; it often forms in underwater settings like deep-sea slopes or submarine fans.
definition.zh: 一种坚硬、颜色较深、颗粒较粗的砂岩，由岩屑、砂粒和黏土等混合组成；常形成于海底深水环境（如海底扇、海底斜坡等）。

examples.en: The cliff is made of graywacke, so it resists erosion better than softer rocks.
examples.zh: 这段悬崖由杂砂岩构成，因此比更软的岩石更耐侵蚀。

examples.en: Geologists found graywacke layers that suggest the area was once a deep ocean basin.
examples.zh: 地质学家发现了杂砂岩地层，说明这里曾经可能是深海盆地。

extraExplanation: 词源与拼写：graywacke 也常写作 greywacke（英式拼写更常见）。词源来自德语 Grauwacke，意为“灰色的 wacke（粗砂岩类）”。
语域提示：这是地质学/岩石学里的专业词，在日常英语里不常见；阅读地质报告、野外考察记录或自然类书籍时更可能遇到。
辨析：graywacke（杂砂岩）通常“成分杂、基质多（含较多泥质/黏土）”，与更“干净”、分选更好的 quartz sandstone（石英砂岩）形成对比。

summary.en: “Graywall” can mean a gray-colored wall, or (informally) a tactic of giving calm, neutral responses to avoid emotional engagement.
summary.zh: “graywall”可以指“灰色的墙”，也可非正式地指一种用冷静中性回应来避免情绪卷入的沟通策略。

definition.en: a wall that is gray in color (literal meaning).
definition.zh: 灰色的墙（字面意思）。

examples.en: The gallery has a gray wall that makes bright paintings stand out.
examples.zh: 画廊有一面灰色的墙，让鲜艳的画作更显眼。

examples.en: We painted the living-room wall gray to create a calm feeling.
examples.zh: 我们把客厅的墙刷成灰色，营造一种平静的感觉。

definition.en: (informal, from psychology/social media) a communication tactic: responding in a flat, neutral, boring way to avoid giving emotional reactions—often used to protect yourself from manipulation or conflict.
definition.zh: （非正式，源自心理学/社媒）一种沟通策略：用平淡、中性、无聊的方式回应，以避免给出情绪反应——常用于自我保护，减少被操控或升级冲突。

examples.en: When he tried to provoke her, she graywalled and changed the subject.
examples.zh: 当他试图激怒她时，她用“灰墙式回应”保持冷淡，并转移了话题。

examples.en: If the conversation feels unsafe, you can graywall: short answers, no extra details.
examples.zh: 如果对话让你觉得不安全，你可以用“灰墙”：简短回答，不多解释。

examples.en: He used graywall responses like “Okay” and “I see” to stop the argument from growing.
examples.zh: 他用“好的”“我明白”这类灰墙式回应，防止争吵升级。

extraExplanation: “graywall/greywall”在英文里并不是传统词典里非常固定的标准词，更常见的说法是“grey rock（灰岩）”或“stonewall（冷处理/阻挠沟通）”。
和“stonewall”不同，“graywall”更强调“不给情绪燃料、降低互动强度”，未必是拒绝沟通；使用时要注意语境，避免在需要真诚沟通的关系中被理解为冷漠或敷衍。

summary.en: Grayware is borderline software that may be unwanted or privacy-invasive but isn’t always outright malware.
summary.zh: Grayware 指介于正常软件与恶意软件之间、可能令人不适或侵犯隐私但不一定构成明确恶意的软件。

definition.en: software that is not clearly harmless or clearly malicious; it may track user behavior, show unwanted ads, or change settings without full consent
definition.zh: 介于正常软件与恶意软件之间的“灰色软件”；通常不一定直接破坏系统，但可能在未充分同意下追踪行为、弹窗广告或更改设置

examples.en: Some antivirus programs flag browser toolbars as grayware because they collect data.
examples.zh: 一些杀毒软件会把浏览器工具栏标记为灰色软件，因为它们会收集数据。

examples.en: The app isn’t a virus, but it installs extra add-ons—many people call that grayware.
examples.zh: 这个应用不是病毒，但会安装额外插件——很多人把这种称为灰色软件。

extraExplanation: “Grayware”是“gray/grey（灰色）+ software”的合成词，强调“界线不清”：它常通过冗长的许可协议、默认勾选、捆绑安装等方式获得“表面同意”，但用户体验上仍可能被认为具有侵扰性。
常见类型包括：广告软件（adware）、间谍软件（spyware，部分场景下也会被归为恶意软件）、浏览器劫持插件、潜在不需要的程序/应用（PUP/PUA）。不同安全厂商对是否归类为grayware的标准可能不同。
使用建议：下载时选择可信来源、安装时取消不必要的捆绑选项、定期检查浏览器扩展与开机启动项。

summary.en: “graywether” is not a standard English word; it is most likely a misspelling of “gray weather” (cloudy, dull weather) or a personal name.
summary.zh: “graywether”不是标准英语词；多半是“gray weather（阴沉天气）”的误拼，或是人名/专有名词。

definition.en: (Likely) a misspelling of “gray weather,” meaning dull, cloudy, often rainy weather with little sunshine.
definition.zh: （很可能）是“gray weather”的拼写错误，指阴沉、多云、常带雨、阳光很少的天气。

examples.en: We’ve had gray weather all week, so the streets feel quieter than usual.
examples.zh: 我们这周一直是阴沉的天气，所以街上比平时安静。

examples.en: Gray weather can make photos look soft and muted.
examples.zh: 阴天会让照片看起来更柔和、颜色更低饱和。

definition.en: A rare or nonstandard spelling that may appear as a surname/username (e.g., “Graywether”). It is not a common English dictionary word.
definition.zh: 一种罕见或非标准拼写，可能作为姓氏/用户名出现（如“Graywether”）；它不是常见的英语词典词汇。

examples.en: The email address uses “graywether,” but it may be a personal name rather than a vocabulary word.
examples.zh: 这个邮箱地址用了“graywether”，但它可能是人名而不是词汇。

extraExplanation: 英语里更常见的表达是“gray weather / grey weather”（美式通常拼 gray，英式常拼 grey）。如果你想表达“阴天、阴冷的天气”，也可以说：overcast weather（阴天）、gloomy weather（阴沉的天气）、dreary weather（沉闷的坏天气）。
如果你本来想输入的是某个人名/作品名（比如小说角色、品牌名等），“Graywether”可能是刻意改拼的专有名词；你可以补充上下文（句子或出处），我能更准确地解释。

summary.en: “Grazable” means land or plants can be eaten by grazing animals; suitable for grazing.
summary.zh: “grazable”指土地或植被可被放牧动物啃食，适合放牧。

definition.en: Able to be grazed; suitable for animals to eat the grass or other low plants growing there.
definition.zh: 可供（牲畜）放牧或啃食的；适合吃草/低矮植物的（地、植被）。

examples.en: The valley has wide, grazable land for cattle.
examples.zh: 这个山谷有大片可供牛放牧的土地。

examples.en: After the rains, the hills become more grazable.
examples.zh: 下雨后，这些山坡变得更适合放牧。

extraExplanation: “grazable”来自动词 graze（放牧、啃食）+ 形容词后缀 -able（“能够……的”）。常用于农业、生态与土地管理语境，如 grazable land（可放牧地）、grazable pasture（可放牧的牧场）。
在环保或资源管理文章里，grazable 也常暗示“可持续放牧”的讨论：土地是否承载得住牲畜啃食，以及过度放牧（overgrazing）带来的退化问题。

summary.en: Graze means either animals eating grass, or something touching/scraping lightly (sometimes causing a small wound).
summary.zh: Graze 既可指动物“吃草/放牧”，也可指“轻擦而过、擦伤”。

definition.en: (of animals) to eat grass or other plants in a field, usually little by little.
definition.zh: （动物）吃草；（在草地上）啃食植物。

examples.en: Cows were grazing in the pasture.
examples.zh: 牛在牧场里吃草。

examples.en: Sheep graze on the hillside all summer.
examples.zh: 羊整个夏天都在山坡上吃草。

definition.en: To let animals feed on grass in a field.
definition.zh: 放（牲畜）去吃草；放牧。

examples.en: They graze their cattle on public land.
examples.zh: 他们把牛放到公有土地上吃草。

examples.en: The farmer grazed the sheep near the river.
examples.zh: 农夫把羊放到河边吃草。

definition.en: To touch something lightly while passing; to scrape lightly or cause a small injury.
definition.zh: 轻擦；擦过；（轻微）擦伤。

examples.en: The bullet grazed his arm.
examples.zh: 子弹擦过他的手臂。

examples.en: The car grazed the fence, leaving a small mark.
examples.zh: 车擦到围栏，留下了一点痕迹。

definition.en: A light touch or scrape; a small surface wound.
definition.zh: 轻擦；擦伤（表皮的小伤口）。

examples.en: He got a graze on his knee after falling.
examples.zh: 他摔倒后膝盖擦伤了。

extraExplanation: 在英式英语里，名词 graze 常指“擦伤/表皮擦伤”；美式英语更常用 scrape / abrasion。
“graze”表示“轻擦而过”，常带有“差一点就严重击中”的感觉（如子弹只擦过手臂）。

summary.en: Grazeable means “able to be grazed,” especially land or plants suitable for animals to feed on.
summary.zh: Grazeable 指“可供放牧取食的”，多用于描述适合牛羊等吃草的土地或植被。

definition.en: Able to be grazed (eaten) by animals; suitable for animals to feed on in a field.
definition.zh: 可供（牛羊等）放牧取食的；适合放牧的。

examples.en: The hillside is grazable in spring, but it dries out in late summer.
examples.zh: 这片山坡春天适合放牧，但夏末会变得干燥。

examples.en: They fenced off the grazable area to protect the young trees.
examples.zh: 他们把可放牧的区域围起来，以保护幼树。

definition.en: Able to be lightly touched or brushed against (“graze” in the sense of a slight contact). (Less common.)
definition.zh: 可被轻微擦碰到的（“graze”作“擦过、掠过”义）；较少用。

examples.en: The bicycle passed close enough that my sleeve was grazable.
examples.zh: 那辆自行车擦身而过，近到我的袖子几乎要被擦到。

extraExplanation: “grazeable”也常拼作“grazable”，两者意思相同；在农业、生态与土地管理语境中更常见“grazable land/area”（可放牧土地/区域）。
词根来自动词“graze”（牛羊吃草；或轻擦），后缀“-able”表示“能够被……的/适合……的”。

summary.en: “Grazed” means lightly touched or scraped past, caused a minor scrape on skin, or (of animals) ate grass.
summary.zh: “grazed”表示轻轻擦过/掠过、擦伤皮肤，或（动物）吃草/放牧。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “graze”: to touch or hit something lightly while passing by (often without stopping).
definition.zh: “graze”的过去式/过去分词：擦过、掠过（轻轻碰到或轻微撞到，通常不停下）。

examples.en: The ball grazed the post and went out.
examples.zh: 球擦过门柱后出了界。

examples.en: A car grazed my bike, but I wasn’t hurt.
examples.zh: 一辆车擦到我的自行车，但我没有受伤。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “graze”: to scrape the skin slightly, causing a minor injury.
definition.zh: “graze”的过去式/过去分词：擦伤（皮肤被轻微刮破，造成小伤口）。

examples.en: She fell and grazed her knee.
examples.zh: 她摔倒了，擦伤了膝盖。

examples.en: He grazed his arm on the fence.
examples.zh: 他的手臂在栅栏上擦伤了。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “graze”: (of animals) to eat grass or other plants in a field.
definition.zh: “graze”的过去式/过去分词：（动物）吃草、放牧。

examples.en: The cows grazed quietly in the meadow.
examples.zh: 奶牛在草地上安静地吃草。

examples.en: We watched sheep that had grazed there all day.
examples.zh: 我们看着那些在那儿吃了一整天草的羊。

extraExplanation: “graze”既可表示“擦过/掠过”（动作很轻、几乎不明显），也常用于“擦伤”（通常是小伤口，不像 cut 那样割得很深）。在英式英语里，“a graze”也常用作名词，指“擦伤”。

summary.en: A grazer is usually an animal that eats grass; it can also mean a person who snacks often, or someone from Graz, Austria.
summary.zh: grazer 通常指吃草的动物；也可指少量多次吃东西的人，或指奥地利格拉茨（Graz）人。

definition.en: an animal that feeds mainly on grass or other low plants (by grazing)
definition.zh: （以吃草等低矮植物为主的）食草动物；放牧动物

examples.en: Cows and sheep are common grazers on this farm.
examples.zh: 在这个农场，牛和羊是常见的食草动物。

examples.en: Too many grazers can damage the grassland.
examples.zh: 食草动物数量过多会破坏草原。

definition.en: a person who eats small amounts of food repeatedly over time instead of having full meals
definition.zh: （不正餐而）少量多次吃东西的人；爱“零食式进食”的人

examples.en: I’m more of a grazer—I snack throughout the day.
examples.zh: 我更像是个“零食式进食”的人——一天到晚会吃点小东西。

examples.en: Grazers often prefer smaller portions.
examples.zh: 这类人往往更喜欢小份量。

definition.en: someone from Graz, a city in Austria (a demonym)
definition.zh: 奥地利格拉茨（Graz）人

examples.en: She’s a Grazer who moved to New York for work.
examples.zh: 她是格拉茨人，为了工作搬到了纽约。

extraExplanation: 在生态与农业语境里，grazers（食草动物）常与 browsers（取食灌木、树叶等较高植物的动物，如鹿）相对。
专有名词 Grazer 指“格拉茨人”，Graz 是奥地利第二大城市；写作时通常首字母大写以区分普通名词 grazer。

summary.en: Grazers are usually grass-eating animals; informally, it can also mean people who snack little by little instead of eating full meals.
summary.zh: grazers通常指以草为食的食草动物；口语中也可指不吃正餐、而是少量多次吃东西的人。

definition.en: Animals that feed mainly on grass or other low plants by eating little by little over time.
definition.zh: 以草或其他低矮植物为主要食物、通过不断啃食来取食的动物（食草动物）。

examples.en: Cows and sheep are common grazers on farms.
examples.zh: 牛和羊是农场里常见的食草动物。

examples.en: The savanna supports many grazers such as zebras and antelopes.
examples.zh: 稀树草原养育了许多食草动物，比如斑马和羚羊。

definition.en: People who eat small amounts of food repeatedly instead of having full meals.
definition.zh: （口语）不吃正餐、而是少量多次吃东西的人。

examples.en: I’m more of a grazer—I snack throughout the day.
examples.zh: 我更像“少量多次吃”的人——我一天到晚都会吃点零食。

examples.en: Office grazers often keep nuts or fruit at their desks.
examples.zh: 办公室里“少量多次吃”的人常在桌上放坚果或水果。

extraExplanation: “grazer”来自动词“graze”（啃食、放牧）。在生态学里常用来指“草食动物/放牧动物”，强调它们通过持续取食影响草地生态。
日常口语里把人叫作“a grazer”，语气通常中性，表示饮食习惯像“边忙边吃、少量多次”。

summary.en: “Grazes” can mean an animal eats grass, something brushes past lightly, or skin gets slightly scraped; it can also be the plural noun for small scrapes.
summary.zh: “grazes”可指动物吃草、轻轻擦过，或造成轻微擦伤；也可作名词复数，指几处小擦伤。

definition.en: (of animals) to eat grass or other low plants in a field; third-person singular form of “graze.”
definition.zh: （动物）在野外吃草或低矮植物；为“graze”的第三人称单数形式。

examples.en: The sheep grazes quietly on the hillside.
examples.zh: 羊在山坡上安静地吃草。

examples.en: A cow grazes near the river every morning.
examples.zh: 每天早晨都有一头牛在河边吃草。

definition.en: to touch something lightly while passing by (often by accident); third-person singular form of “graze.”
definition.zh: （擦边）轻轻触到（通常是无意的）；为“graze”的第三人称单数形式。

examples.en: The ball grazes the post and goes out of play.
examples.zh: 球擦到了门柱，然后出了界。

examples.en: His shoulder grazes the wall as he squeezes through.
examples.zh: 他挤过去时肩膀擦到墙。

definition.en: to scrape the skin slightly, causing a small, shallow injury; third-person singular form of “graze.”
definition.zh: （擦伤）轻微擦破皮肤，造成浅表小伤口；为“graze”的第三人称单数形式。

examples.en: He falls and grazes his knee on the pavement.
examples.zh: 他摔倒了，膝盖在人行道上擦伤了。

examples.en: The branch grazes her arm and leaves a thin red mark.
examples.zh: 树枝擦到她的手臂，留下了一道细红印。

definition.en: small scrapes on the skin; plural of the noun “graze.”
definition.zh: （皮肤上的）轻微擦伤；名词“graze”的复数。

examples.en: She had a few grazes on her hands after the fall.
examples.zh: 她摔倒后手上有几处擦伤。

extraExplanation: “graze”作“吃草”时常用于描写牛、羊等在草地上进食；作“擦到/擦伤”时，强调“轻微接触或表皮浅伤”，比“cut（割伤）”“bruise（淤青）”更轻。

summary.en: “Grazie” means “thank you” in Italian.
summary.zh: “grazie”在意大利语中表示“谢谢”。

definition.en: “Grazie” is an Italian word meaning “thank you.”
definition.zh: “grazie”是意大利语，意思是“谢谢”。

examples.en: Grazie for your help!
examples.zh: 谢谢你的帮助！

examples.en: He smiled and said, “Grazie.”
examples.zh: 他笑着说：“谢谢。”

extraExplanation: “Grazie”常见于意大利旅行、餐厅点餐或与意大利人交流时。更礼貌/更正式可以说“Grazie mille”（非常感谢）或“Molte grazie”（多谢）。在口语里也常听到“Grazie!”单独使用。

summary.en: A grazier is someone who raises grazing animals, especially cattle or sheep, mainly by letting them feed on pasture.
summary.zh: grazier 指放牧饲养牲畜（尤指牛羊）的人，强调让牲畜在牧场上吃草的饲养方式。

definition.en: a person who raises and feeds grazing animals (especially cattle or sheep) for meat or sale
definition.zh: 放牧饲养者；以放牧方式饲养牲畜（尤指牛或羊）用于出售或肉用的人

examples.en: The grazier moved the cattle to higher fields during the dry season.
examples.zh: 旱季时，那位放牧户把牛群转移到更高的牧场。

examples.en: Local graziers met to discuss water rights and pasture access.
examples.zh: 当地的放牧饲养者开会讨论用水权和牧地使用问题。

extraExplanation: “Grazier”主要用于英式英语、澳大利亚和新西兰等畜牧业语境中；在美式英语里更常见的近义说法是“rancher（牧场主）”或“cattle farmer（养牛农户）”，但“grazier”更强调“放牧（grazing）”这种饲养方式，而不一定强调拥有大型牧场。
词源上与“graze（吃草、放牧）”相关，因此它通常指让牲畜在草地上觅食的人。

summary.en: Grazierdom means the profession or community of graziers—people who raise livestock on pasture.
summary.zh: grazierdom 指放牧业，或牧场主（放牧者）这一行业/群体。

definition.en: the profession, industry, or world of graziers (people who raise livestock by letting them feed on pasture).
definition.zh: 放牧业；牧牛（羊）者的行业／圈子（graziers 的职业、产业或群体）

examples.en: In the 1800s, conflicts over land and water strongly shaped Australian grazierdom.
examples.zh: 在19世纪，土地和水源之争深刻影响了澳大利亚的放牧业圈子。

examples.en: New grazing rules were welcomed by some in grazierdom but criticized by others.
examples.zh: 新的放牧规定受到一些牧场主群体的欢迎，但也被另一些人批评。

extraExplanation: 这是一个相对少见、带有“书面/新闻评论”色彩的词，常见于讨论农业政策、土地使用、牧场经济或阶层/利益集团时。
词缀 -dom 表示“领域、状态、群体”（如 kingdom 王国，freedom 自由）。grazierdom 直译可理解为“牧场主的领域/圈子”。
grazier 指“以放牧为主的牧场经营者”，更强调让牲畜在草场上吃草（pasture），与一般的 farmer（更广义的农场主）有所区别。

summary.en: Graziers are people who raise animals like cattle or sheep by letting them feed on grassland.
summary.zh: Graziers 指让牛羊等牲畜在草地上吃草放牧的畜牧从业者（牧场主）。

definition.en: A person who raises grazing animals (especially cattle or sheep) on grassland; a rancher or pastoral farmer.
definition.zh: 放牧牲畜（尤指牛或羊）的人；牧场主；畜牧农民。

examples.en: Many graziers move their herds to higher ground during the dry season.
examples.zh: 许多牧场主在旱季会把牛羊赶到地势更高的地方。

examples.en: The government offered support to graziers after the drought damaged pastureland.
examples.zh: 干旱破坏了牧草地后，政府向牧场主提供了援助。

examples.en: Graziers often work closely with veterinarians to keep livestock healthy.
examples.zh: 牧场主常常与兽医密切合作，以保持牲畜健康。

extraExplanation: “grazier”来自动词“graze”（吃草、放牧）。在新闻或农业语境里常见，尤其用于英式英语、澳大利亚和新西兰，常与“pastoralist（牧业经营者）”“station owner（大型牧场主）”等词一起出现。
用法提示：单数是“a grazier”，复数是“graziers”。在美式语境中，更常用“rancher（牧场主）”或“cattle rancher（养牛牧场主）”。

summary.en: “Graziery” is usually a misspelling of **grazier**: a person who raises animals on pasture.
summary.zh: “graziery” 多半是 **grazier** 的误拼：指在牧场放牧饲养牲畜的人。

definition.en: (Commonly spelled **grazier**) a person who raises and feeds animals (especially cattle or sheep) on grass pasture.
definition.zh: （常见拼写为 **grazier**）放牧者；牧场主：在草地牧场上饲养（尤指牛或羊）的人。

examples.en: The grazier moved the cattle to a new pasture after the rain.
examples.zh: 下雨后，那位牧场主把牛群转移到了新的牧场。

examples.en: Many graziers depend on good grass growth in spring.
examples.zh: 许多放牧者都依赖春季牧草的良好生长。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **graziery** 通常不是标准拼写。最常见、正确的名词是 **grazier**（放牧者/牧场主）。
**grazier** 来自动词 **graze**（吃草；放牧）。在农业英语里很常见，尤其在澳大利亚、英国等以畜牧业闻名的地区。

summary.en: “Grazing” most often means animals eating grass in a field, and it can also mean a light scrape or slight contact that may cause a small surface wound.
summary.zh: “grazing”最常指动物在草地上吃草/放牧；也可指轻轻擦到（造成）擦伤或轻微碰擦。

definition.en: (Of animals) eating grass or other plants in a field.
definition.zh: （动物）在草地或田野里吃草或啃食植物。

examples.en: The cows are grazing in the pasture.
examples.zh: 奶牛正在牧场里吃草。

examples.en: We saw a herd of deer grazing near the forest.
examples.zh: 我们看到一群鹿在森林附近吃草。

definition.en: A place where animals feed on grass; grassland used for feeding animals.
definition.zh: （供牲畜吃草的）牧草地；放牧地。

examples.en: This land is used for grazing in summer.
examples.zh: 这片土地夏天用来放牧。

examples.en: The farmer rents extra grazing for his sheep.
examples.zh: 农民为羊租了额外的放牧地。

definition.en: Touching or hitting something lightly while passing by; a slight contact (often by accident).
definition.zh: （经过时）轻轻擦到；（常指无意的）轻微碰触。

examples.en: The ball just grazed the post and went out.
examples.zh: 球只是擦到门柱就出界了。

examples.en: A stone grazed his arm, leaving a small scratch.
examples.zh: 一块石头擦到他的手臂，留下了一道小划痕。

definition.en: A minor surface wound caused by scraping; a small scrape.
definition.zh: 擦伤；表皮轻微刮伤。

examples.en: She fell off her bike and got a graze on her knee.
examples.zh: 她从自行车上摔下来，膝盖擦伤了。

examples.en: It’s only a graze—clean it and cover it.
examples.zh: 只是擦伤——清洗一下再贴上创可贴。

extraExplanation: “grazing”既可以指“吃草/放牧”，也常用于“轻轻擦到（造成擦伤）”。学习时可用场景区分：农场/草地多半是吃草；球、子弹、石头等高速物体“擦过”则多半是轻微碰擦。
常见搭配：graze on（以……为食，如 sheep graze on grass）；graze past/along（擦着……经过）；go grazing（去放牧/去吃草）。

summary.en: “Grazingly” means either “while grazing (eating grass)” or “lightly/in passing, as if just brushing against something.”
summary.zh: “grazingly”可指“（动物）在吃草/放牧时”，也可引申为“轻微地、顺带地（像擦过一样）”。

definition.en: In a way that involves grazing (animals eating grass); while feeding on grass or plants.
definition.zh: 以（动物）吃草、放牧的方式；在啃食草或植物时。

examples.en: Cattle moved slowly, grazingly, across the hillside.
examples.zh: 牛群缓慢地移动，在山坡上边走边吃草。

examples.en: The sheep spread out and wandered grazingly through the field.
examples.zh: 羊群散开，在田野里一边游走一边啃食。

definition.en: Lightly and briefly; in a way that just touches or affects something without going deep or direct.
definition.zh: 轻微地、短暂地；以“擦过/掠过”的方式，影响不深、不直接。

examples.en: The ball passed grazingly against his shoulder.
examples.zh: 球擦过他的肩膀飞了过去。

examples.en: She spoke grazingly about the issue, then changed the subject.
examples.zh: 她只是轻描淡写地提了一下这个问题，就换了话题。

extraExplanation: “grazingly”来自动词/名词 graze。graze 有两条常见意义：①（动物）吃草、放牧；②（物体）轻擦、掠过（如子弹擦伤）。因此 grazingly 也常有“轻轻带过/轻微触及”的引申用法。
在现代英语中，“grazingly”不算高频，更常见的表达是 “while grazing / in a grazing manner” 或用 “slightly / briefly / in passing” 来替换（取决于语境）。

summary.en: “Grazings” most often means plural pasture areas for animals to feed; it can also mean minor scrapes/brushes, and (informally) repeated small snacking occasions.
summary.zh: “grazings”最常指动物取食的牧场/放牧地（复数）；也可指轻微擦伤/擦痕；非正式语境中还可指少量多次的“零食式进食”。

definition.en: areas of grassland or pasture where animals (especially sheep or cattle) feed
definition.zh: （尤指牛羊的）放牧地，牧场（复数）

examples.en: The farmer moved the herd to fresh grazings in early spring.
examples.zh: 农夫在早春把牛群转移到新的牧场。

examples.en: These mountain grazings are shared by several villages.
examples.zh: 这些山地牧场由几个村庄共同使用。

definition.en: light, brief touches or scrapes; minor injuries caused by brushing against something
definition.zh: 擦碰、掠过；轻微擦伤（复数）

examples.en: He escaped with only a few grazings on his arm.
examples.zh: 他只是在手臂上有几处轻微擦伤就脱险了。

examples.en: The car had small grazings along the side panel.
examples.zh: 车身侧面有几处轻微擦痕。

definition.en: the habit of eating small amounts of food repeatedly throughout the day (informal/modern use); plural occasions of this behavior
definition.zh: （非正式）少量多次进食；“随时吃一点”的多次行为（复数）

examples.en: Try replacing late-night grazings with a planned snack.
examples.zh: 试着把深夜随便吃几口改成有计划的加餐。

examples.en: Weekend grazings can add up to a lot of calories.
examples.zh: 周末这种“零食式进食”加起来会摄入很多热量。

extraExplanation: “grazings”最常见的用法是名词复数，指“牧场/放牧地”，在英式英语和农业语境里更常见。
如果你想表达“正在吃草/放牧”这个动作，一般用动词或现在分词“grazing”（例如：Cows are grazing. 牛在吃草），而不是“grazings”。
“擦伤/擦痕”这个意思来自动词 graze（擦到、掠过），日常医疗或车损描述里会见到。

summary.en: Grazioso means “graceful/charming,” and in music it tells you to play “gracefully.”
summary.zh: grazioso意为“优雅/迷人”；在音乐中表示“以优雅的风格演奏”。

definition.en: Graceful, elegant, or charming in style or movement (often used as a descriptive word in art, dance, or writing).
definition.zh: （风格或动作）优雅的、娴雅的、迷人的（常用于艺术、舞蹈或描写）。

examples.en: Her gestures were grazioso, light and controlled.
examples.zh: 她的动作很grazioso，轻盈而有控制力。

examples.en: The painter gave the figure a grazioso posture.
examples.zh: 画家让人物呈现出一种优雅的姿态。

definition.en: (Music) A direction meaning “gracefully” or “with graceful charm,” telling the performer the character of the passage.
definition.zh: （音乐术语）“优雅地/带着优雅的韵味”，提示演奏者该段落的风格与气质。

examples.en: Play the melody grazioso, not too heavy.
examples.zh: 旋律要grazioso地演奏，不要太沉重。

examples.en: The score marks the theme as grazioso.
examples.zh: 谱子标注主题要以grazioso的风格呈现。

extraExplanation: “Grazioso”是意大利语外来词，英语里多见于古典音乐的速度/表情术语（类似 allegro, adagio）。在乐谱中它更像“表情提示”，强调质感：轻盈、流畅、带点优雅的魅力，而不是具体的速度。
在英语写作中偶尔也会借用它来营造“欧陆/文艺”的语感；更日常的英语替代词通常是 graceful / elegant / charming。

summary.en: GRE is a standardized graduate-school entrance exam (or its score), common in the U.S.
summary.zh: GRE指研究生入学标准化考试（或其成绩），在美国研究生申请中很常见。

definition.en: a standardized exam used for admission to many graduate schools, especially in the U.S. (short for “Graduate Record Examinations”).
definition.zh: 研究生入学标准化考试（“Graduate Record Examinations”的缩写），常用于申请美国等地的研究生项目。

examples.en: She is studying for the GRE to apply to psychology master’s programs.
examples.zh: 她正在准备GRE，打算申请心理学硕士项目。

examples.en: Some universities no longer require GRE scores for admission.
examples.zh: 一些大学录取时已不再要求提交GRE成绩。

definition.en: the GRE exam score (used in conversation to refer to your result).
definition.zh: GRE成绩（口语中也常用GRE来指考试分数）。

examples.en: My GRE improved after I practiced more math questions.
examples.zh: 我练了更多数学题后，GRE成绩提高了。

examples.en: He sent his GRE to three schools through ETS.
examples.zh: 他通过ETS把GRE成绩寄送给了三所学校。

extraExplanation: GRE由ETS（Educational Testing Service）主办。常见的考试是GRE General Test，一般包括Verbal（语文）、Quantitative（数学）和Analytical Writing（写作）。不同学校/专业对GRE要求差异很大，近年也出现“可选提交（test-optional）”或“不要求（not required）”的趋势。

summary.en: GRE: a standardized test often used for graduate school admissions, especially in the U.S.
summary.zh: GRE：常用于研究生申请（尤其在美国）的标准化考试。

definition.en: a standardized admissions test for graduate school, especially in the U.S. (Graduate Record Examination)
definition.zh: （美国等地）研究生院入学的标准化考试：GRE（Graduate Record Examination，研究生入学考试）

examples.en: Many U.S. graduate programs used to require the GRE for admission.
examples.zh: 许多美国研究生项目过去会要求提交GRE成绩作为录取条件。

examples.en: She is studying vocabulary and math every day for the GRE.
examples.zh: 她每天都在为GRE复习词汇和数学。

examples.en: This university is GRE-optional, so you may not need to submit scores.
examples.zh: 这所大学是“GRE可选”的，所以你可能不需要提交成绩。

extraExplanation: GRE由ETS（Educational Testing Service）主办，常见类型包括GRE General Test（综合）和部分学科的GRE Subject Tests（学科）。综合考试通常涵盖Verbal（文字/阅读与词汇）、Quantitative（数学）与Analytical Writing（写作）。
在申请语境里常见说法：GRE score（GRE成绩）、take the GRE（参加GRE）、GRE requirement（GRE要求）、GRE-optional/waived（可选/免除）。不同学校与专业对GRE的重视程度差异很大，近年不少项目改为可选或不要求。

summary.en: “Grea” is usually a misspelling of “great,” meaning excellent/very good, large in degree, or used as “Great!” to show approval.
summary.zh: “grea”通常是“great”的拼写错误或未写完，意思是“很棒的/非常好的、程度很大”，也可作感叹词表示“太好了！”

definition.en: (common spelling: “great”) very good; large in amount or degree; important.
definition.zh: （常见拼写：great）很好的；大量的/程度很高的；重要的。

examples.en: That’s a great idea.
examples.zh: 那是个好主意。

examples.en: She made great progress this year.
examples.zh: 她今年取得了很大进步。

examples.en: The Great Wall is famous around the world.
examples.zh: 长城举世闻名。

definition.en: used to show approval or satisfaction (often alone).
definition.zh: 用于表达赞同或满意（常单独使用）。

examples.en: “We can meet at 3.” “Great!”
examples.zh: “我们3点见。” “太好了！”

examples.en: Great, thanks for your help.
examples.zh: 太好了，谢谢你的帮助。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“grea”很可能是“great”的拼写未完成或拼写错误。英语里“great”既可表示“很棒的/重要的”，也常用作感叹词表示“太好了！”。

summary.en: “Greable” is not a standard English word; it is most likely a misspelling of “agreeable,” meaning pleasant or acceptable.
summary.zh: “greable”不是标准英语词，最可能是“agreeable”的拼写错误，意思是“令人愉快的/随和的”或“可接受的”。

definition.en: (Likely intended: “agreeable”) pleasant, friendly, and easy to like or work with.
definition.zh: （可能想写的是 agreeable）令人愉快的；友善随和的；好相处的。

examples.en: She’s an agreeable person who gets along with everyone.
examples.zh: 她很随和，和大家都相处得来。

examples.en: We had an agreeable conversation over coffee.
examples.zh: 我们边喝咖啡边聊得很愉快。

examples.en: The weather today is warm and agreeable.
examples.zh: 今天天气温暖宜人。

definition.en: (Likely intended: “agreeable”) acceptable or satisfactory; okay with someone.
definition.zh: （可能想写的是 agreeable）可接受的；令人满意的；（某人）同意的。

examples.en: Is 3 p.m. agreeable to you?
examples.zh: 下午三点你方便/可以吗？

examples.en: They reached a solution agreeable to both sides.
examples.zh: 他们达成了一个双方都能接受的解决方案。

extraExplanation: “greable”不是常见英语单词，最常见的情况是把“agreeable”拼错了（少了开头的 a-，以及中间字母顺序）。如果你想表达“可分级的”，可能是“gradable”；如果你指的是专业/罕见用法，请告诉我你看到它的句子，我可以帮你确认。

summary.en: “Greably” is not standard English; it’s usually a misspelling of “agreeably,” meaning “pleasantly” or “with approval.”
summary.zh: “greably”不是标准英文，通常是“agreeably”的拼写错误，意思是“令人愉快地/舒服地”或“表示赞同地”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard spelling) Usually a misspelling of “agreeably.”
definition.zh: （非标准拼写）通常是“agreeably”的拼写错误。

examples.en: I think you mean “agreeably,” not “greably.”
examples.zh: 你想写的应该是“agreeably”，不是“greably”。

examples.en: The weather was agreeably warm today.
examples.zh: 今天的天气暖得很舒服。

definition.en: In a pleasant or enjoyable way; pleasantly.
definition.zh: 愉快地；令人舒适地。

examples.en: We were agreeably surprised by the low price.
examples.zh: 这个低价让我们又惊又喜。

examples.en: The room was agreeably quiet in the morning.
examples.zh: 早晨房间安静得让人感觉很舒服。

definition.en: In a way that shows you accept or approve of something; willingly or with agreement.
definition.zh: 表示赞同或接受地；乐意地。

examples.en: She nodded agreeably and signed the form.
examples.zh: 她赞同地点点头，然后签了表格。

examples.en: He spoke agreeably about the plan.
examples.zh: 他用赞同的语气谈论这个计划。

extraExplanation: “greably”不是常见或标准英文单词；在写作和考试中建议改用“agreeably”。
“agreeably”常见搭配：agreeably surprised（惊喜地）、agreeably warm/cool/quiet（舒适地暖/凉/安静）。
语气提示：表示“pleasantly（舒服地）”比表示“in agreement（赞同地）”更常见；若要强调“赞同”，也可用“willingly / approvingly”。

summary.en: “Grease” usually means oily fat or lubricant; as a verb, it means to lubricate, and informally it can mean to “smooth things over” (sometimes by bribery).
summary.zh: “grease”通常指油脂/润滑脂；作动词指给……上油；口语里也可指“打点让事情更顺”（有时暗含行贿）。

definition.en: (Likely intended: “grease”) a thick oily substance (often fat or oil) used in cooking or for lubrication.
definition.zh: （可能想写的是：grease）油脂；（烹饪用的）油；（机械用的）润滑脂。

examples.en: There’s grease on the pan—be careful, it’s slippery.
examples.zh: 锅上有油，小心点，会滑。

examples.en: The mechanic added grease to the moving parts.
examples.zh: 修理工给活动部件加了润滑脂。

definition.en: to put grease on something so it moves smoothly; to lubricate.
definition.zh: 给……上油；润滑。

examples.en: Grease the door hinges so they stop squeaking.
examples.zh: 给门铰链上点油，这样就不吱吱响了。

examples.en: He greased the baking tray before adding the dough.
examples.zh: 他先给烤盘抹油，再放面团。

definition.en: (informal) to help something happen more easily, often by giving money or special favors (e.g., “grease the wheels,” “grease someone’s palm”).
definition.zh: （非正式）用“打点/行贿/送好处”等方式让事情更顺利（如“grease the wheels”“grease someone’s palm”）。

examples.en: They tried to grease the wheels to speed up the paperwork.
examples.zh: 他们试图“打点一下”来加快手续办理。

examples.en: He refused to grease anyone’s palm.
examples.zh: 他拒绝向任何人行贿。

extraExplanation: “greacas” 不是常见英语单词，很可能是拼写错误。最接近、最常用的词是 “grease”。如果你想表达的是别的词（例如 *Greece* 希腊，或 *greasy* 油腻的），告诉我你的句子语境，我可以帮你确认。
文化/用法提示：*grease the wheels* 原意是“给轮子上油让它转得更顺”，引申为“让流程更顺畅”。在一些语境里会暗示不正当手段（比如行贿），使用时要注意场合。

summary.en: “Grease” most commonly means oily fat or lubricant, and it can also mean to lubricate something; informally, it can mean to bribe.
summary.zh: “Grease”最常见指油脂/润滑脂，也可作动词表示给……上油；非正式用法还可指行贿。

definition.en: A thick oily substance (often from animal fat or petroleum) used to lubricate machines or as cooking fat.
definition.zh: （常指动物脂肪或石油制的）油脂、润滑脂；也可指用于烹饪的油脂。

examples.en: Put a little grease on the hinges so the door won’t squeak.
examples.zh: 在铰链上抹点润滑脂，这样门就不会吱吱响了。

examples.en: There was grease splattered all over the stove after frying bacon.
examples.zh: 煎培根后，炉子上到处都是油渍飞溅。

definition.en: To apply grease to something; to lubricate.
definition.zh: 给……上油（脂）；润滑。

examples.en: He greased the chain before the long bike ride.
examples.zh: 长途骑行前他给链条上了油。

examples.en: The mechanic greased all the moving parts.
examples.zh: 修理工给所有活动部件都加了润滑脂。

definition.en: Informal: to bribe someone (often in the phrase “grease someone’s palm”).
definition.zh: （非正式）贿赂；行贿（常见于短语“grease someone’s palm”）。

examples.en: Some people think you have to grease the right palms to get things done.
examples.zh: 有些人觉得要“打点一下”才能把事情办成。

extraExplanation: “Grease”作名词时既可指机械用的“润滑脂”，也常指烹饪后留下的“油渍/油腻”。在日常英语里，谈到清洁时更常用“grease”表示难清理的油污。
俚语用法“grease someone’s palm”字面是“给某人的手心抹油”，引申为“塞钱打点、行贿”，带有明显的负面含义，正式场合应避免使用或谨慎使用。
文化提示：在美国流行文化里，《Grease》（1978）是一部非常有名的青春歌舞电影（片名与“油脂/油腻”的字面义有关，也暗示50年代“发油”造型与“greaser”文化）。

summary.en: “Greaseball” is usually an offensive slang insult for a greasy/dirty person; it can also literally mean a lump of grease.
summary.zh: “greaseball”通常是冒犯性的俚语辱骂，指油腻/邋遢的人；也可字面指一团油脂。

definition.en: (slang, offensive) An insulting word for a person who looks or seems greasy, dirty, or unpleasant (often implying untrustworthy behavior).
definition.zh: （俚语，冒犯性）对某人的侮辱性称呼，指其看起来油腻、邋遢、令人不适，常带有“不可靠/不正派”的暗示。

examples.en: That comment was rude—don’t call people a greaseball.
examples.zh: 那句话很无礼——别用“greaseball”骂人。

examples.en: He was described as a “greaseball” in the review, which felt mean and personal.
examples.zh: 评论里把他形容成“greaseball”，这听起来很刻薄、很针对个人。

definition.en: (informal, literal) A ball or lump of grease; something covered with a lot of grease.
definition.zh: （非正式，字面义）一团油脂；油腻腻的一团东西。

examples.en: After the food cooled, a greaseball formed on top of the soup.
examples.zh: 食物冷却后，汤面上结了一团油。

extraExplanation: “greaseball”在日常英语里主要是骂人的词，语气很难听；在职场、学校或正式场合应避免使用。
它有时也被当作带有族裔歧视色彩的辱称（历史上曾被用来贬低某些移民群体，如意大利裔等），因此更容易引发冲突。更安全的表达是描述具体行为或外观：例如 “He didn’t look clean.”（他看起来不太干净）或 “That was dishonest.”（那样不诚实）。

summary.en: Greasebush is a common name for certain hardy desert shrubs with oily/resinous leaves, especially in the western U.S.
summary.zh: Greasebush 是一种俗称，常指美西等地叶片带油脂/树脂感、很耐旱的沙漠灌木。

definition.en: a desert shrub with oily or resinous leaves, found especially in the western U.S.; the name is used for several similar shrubs in different regions
definition.zh: （美西等地的）一种沙漠灌木，叶片带油脂或树脂感；该俗名在不同地区可指几种相似的灌木

examples.en: Greasebush grows well in dry, salty soil where many plants can’t survive.
examples.zh: Greasebush 很适应干燥、盐碱的土壤，很多植物在那种环境里活不下去。

examples.en: After the rain, the greasebush gave off a strong, sharp smell.
examples.zh: 下雨后，greasebush 会散发出一种很浓、偏刺激的气味。

extraExplanation: “greasebush”是俗名（common name），不是严格的单一物种名称：在美国西部不同地区，它可能指不同的耐旱灌木（有时也会被拿来指类似的“greasewood/creosote bush”等）。如果你在读自然科普、户外地图或植物图鉴，最好结合地点或拉丁学名来确认具体是哪一种。

summary.en: “Greased” usually means covered with grease (slippery), or informally, very fast. It’s also the past form of “grease” (to lubricate).
summary.zh: “greased”常指“涂了油的/很滑的”，口语里也可指“非常快”。它还是“grease（上油润滑）”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: covered with grease or oil; made slippery by grease
definition.zh: 涂了油脂的；油腻的；被润滑得很滑的

examples.en: The pan was still greased, so the cake came out easily.
examples.zh: 烤盘还抹着油，所以蛋糕很容易脱模。

examples.en: Be careful—the floor is greased and very slippery.
examples.zh: 小心——地上有油，很滑。

definition.en: (informal) very fast or moving very smoothly, as if lubricated
definition.zh: （非正式）非常快的；顺畅得像上了润滑油一样

examples.en: He ran out the door like greased lightning.
examples.zh: 他像闪电一样冲出门去。

examples.en: The new wheels made the cart feel almost greased.
examples.zh: 新轮子让推车感觉顺滑得像抹了油。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “grease”: to put grease or oil on something to make it work more smoothly
definition.zh: “grease”的过去式/过去分词：给……上油（润滑），使其运转更顺畅

examples.en: I greased the hinges, and the door stopped squeaking.
examples.zh: 我给门铰链上了油，门就不吱呀响了。

examples.en: The mechanic has already greased the bearings.
examples.zh: 修理工已经给轴承上过油了。

extraExplanation: “greased lightning”是常见口语夸张说法，形容“快得像闪电一样”，带有生动的画面感：好像东西被抹了油，滑得停不下来。
grease还有引申义，指“用好处打点/行贿”（如：to grease someone’s palm，字面“给某人手心抹油”），因此在某些语境里“greased”可能带“被收买、被打点过”的暗示，但需要看上下文。

summary.en: A slang word (Western U.S.) meaning an inexperienced newcomer or rookie.
summary.zh: 一个带美国西部色彩的俚语，指缺乏经验的新来者/菜鸟。

definition.en: (slang, especially in the American West) A very inexperienced person; a newcomer who doesn’t yet know how things are done (often on a ranch, in mining, or in other rough outdoor work).
definition.zh: （俚语，尤指美国西部）新手；菜鸟；刚来的人（常指牧场、矿区或其他艰苦户外工作中的新人）。

examples.en: The old ranch hands teased the greasehorn for holding the reins the wrong way.
examples.zh: 老牧场工取笑那个新手把缰绳拿反了。

examples.en: Don’t send a greasehorn out alone on night watch.
examples.zh: 别让一个菜鸟独自去值夜班。

examples.en: I was a greasehorn my first week on the job, but people taught me patiently.
examples.zh: 我上班第一周就是个新手，不过大家很耐心地教我。

extraExplanation: “greasehorn”带有明显的口语/西部色彩，语气常带点取笑或轻蔑，但也可能只是半开玩笑的称呼。
它和更常见的“greenhorn”“tenderfoot”意思很接近；在西部题材小说、牛仔故事里更容易看到。

summary.en: Greaseless means not oily or greasy, often used for products, cooking methods, or surfaces that don’t leave oil stains.
summary.zh: greaseless 指“不含油脂的、不油腻的”，常用于描述产品、烹饪方式或表面不留油渍。

definition.en: Not containing grease or oil; not oily or greasy.
definition.zh: 不含油脂的；不油腻的。

examples.en: This is a greaseless lotion, so it won’t leave your hands oily.
examples.zh: 这是一款不油腻的乳液，所以不会让你的手黏黏的。

examples.en: They advertised a greaseless frying method using an air fryer.
examples.zh: 他们宣传用空气炸锅实现“无油（不油腻）”的烹饪方式。

definition.en: Free of oil-based stains or smudges (often describing paper, surfaces, or the feeling after touching something).
definition.zh: 没有油渍的；不易留下油污的（常形容纸张、表面或触感）。

examples.en: Use a greaseless wipe to clean the screen.
examples.zh: 用不留油污的湿巾来擦屏幕。

examples.en: The packaging keeps the food warm but the outside stays greaseless.
examples.zh: 这种包装能保温，但外面摸起来不会油腻。

extraExplanation: “greaseless”由 grease（油脂、油腻）+ -less（没有……的）构成，意思很直观：没有油脂/不油腻。常见于广告文案或产品描述（如护肤品、发品、烹饪方式、清洁用品）。
在日常英语里，更常用的近义表达包括 “non-greasy”（不油腻的）、“oil-free”（不含油的，尤指护肤品）、“low-fat”（低脂的，指食物营养成分而非触感）。选择哪个词取决于你想强调“触感不油”还是“成分无油/低脂”。

summary.en: Greaselessness means the state of being free from grease or oil—clean, non-greasy.
summary.zh: greaselessness 指“无油性/不油腻的状态”，强调没有油脂、清爽干净。

definition.en: The quality or state of being greaseless (having no grease or oil; clean and not oily).
definition.zh: 无油性；不油腻的状态（没有油脂/油渍，显得干净不油）。

examples.en: The greaselessness of the kitchen counter made it look freshly cleaned.
examples.zh: 厨房台面的无油性让它看起来像刚打扫过一样。

examples.en: He preferred the greaselessness of this moisturizer because it didn’t leave a shiny film.
examples.zh: 他更喜欢这款保湿霜的清爽无油感，因为它不会留下发亮的油膜。

extraExplanation: “greaselessness”由形容词“greaseless”（无油的、不油腻的）+ 名词后缀“-ness”（表示“……的性质/状态”）构成。
它不是特别常见的日常词，更常见的表达是“oil-free / non-greasy / grease-free”（无油的/不油腻的）。在护肤品、清洁用品、食品与工业材料描述中更可能出现。
相关词：greasy（油腻的），grease（油脂/润滑脂；给……上油），oiliness（油腻感）。

summary.en: Greasepaint is thick, oily stage makeup used by performers.
summary.zh: Greasepaint 指演员在舞台上使用的厚重油性化妆品（油彩）。

definition.en: Thick, oily makeup used by actors on stage, traditionally made with grease so it shows clearly under strong lights.
definition.zh: （舞台演员用的）油彩，厚重的油性化妆品；因含油脂而在强光下更显眼。

examples.en: Before the show, the actors put on greasepaint in the dressing room.
examples.zh: 演出前，演员们在化妆间涂上油彩。

examples.en: Under bright stage lights, greasepaint helps facial expressions look clearer to the audience.
examples.zh: 在明亮的舞台灯光下，油彩能让观众更清楚看到面部表情。

extraExplanation: “Greasepaint”常让人联想到传统剧院文化：早期舞台灯很强，普通化妆不够显色，所以出现了更厚、更油的“油彩”。现在也常用更现代的舞台底妆，但“greasepaint”仍是经典说法。
这个词有时带一点文学或修辞色彩，用来象征“舞台/表演的世界”，比如把生活比作舞台（life is a stage）的语境里，会提到greasepaint与服装、面具等。

summary.en: “Greaseproof” means oil-resistant and is often used to describe paper that stops grease soaking through.
summary.zh: “greaseproof”意为“防油的”，常用来形容能防止油脂渗透的纸。

definition.en: Resistant to oil or grease; made so that grease does not soak through (often used for paper used in cooking or packaging).
definition.zh: 防油的；防油渗透的（常指烘焙或包装用的纸，不让油脂渗透）。

examples.en: Line the baking tray with greaseproof paper before adding the cookies.
examples.zh: 在放饼干之前，先用防油纸铺好烤盘。

examples.en: The sandwich was wrapped in greaseproof paper to keep the bag clean.
examples.zh: 三明治用防油纸包起来，避免把袋子弄脏。

extraExplanation: “greaseproof”在英式英语里很常见，指烘焙用的防油纸；美式英语更常说“wax paper”（蜡纸）或“parchment paper”（烘焙纸/羊皮纸）。不过这三者并不完全等同：parchment paper通常更耐高温，适合烤箱；wax paper一般不适合高温烘烤。选用时可看包装说明。

summary.en: Greaseproofness means how well a material prevents oil or grease from soaking through.
summary.zh: Greaseproofness 指材料阻止油脂渗透的能力，即“防油性/耐油性”。

definition.en: the quality or state of being greaseproof (able to resist oil or grease soaking through)
definition.zh: 防油性；耐油性（指能阻止油脂渗透或浸透的性质）

examples.en: The greaseproofness of the paper keeps the pastry from leaving oily stains in the bag.
examples.zh: 这种纸的防油性能防止点心把油渍弄到袋子上。

examples.en: We tested the greaseproofness of the packaging before selling it to restaurants.
examples.zh: 在把包装卖给餐厅之前，我们测试了它的防油性。

examples.en: For fried foods, greaseproofness matters more than thickness.
examples.zh: 对油炸食品来说，防油性比厚度更重要。

extraExplanation: “greaseproofness”由形容词“greaseproof（防油的）”加名词后缀“-ness”构成，用来把“特性/性质”名词化。常见于包装、烘焙用纸、外卖盒、食品接触材料等语境。更自然的表达有时会用“grease resistance（耐油性）”或“oil resistance（耐油性）”。

summary.en: Greaser can mean (1) a worker who lubricates machines, (2) a 1950s–60s “greased-hair” working-class youth (slang), or (3) an offensive slur for Mexicans/Latinos (avoid).
summary.zh: Greaser 可指：(1) 给机器上润滑油的工人；(2) 50–60年代以油亮背头等风格著称的工人阶层青年（俚语）；(3) 针对墨西哥人/拉丁裔的种族辱称（应避免使用）。

definition.en: a person whose job is to apply grease/oil to machines so they run smoothly (a maintenance worker)
definition.zh: 给机器上润滑油/黄油的人；润滑工（维修工作的一种）

examples.en: The greaser checks the bearings and adds grease every week.
examples.zh: 润滑工每周检查轴承并加润滑脂。

examples.en: In older factories, a greaser was essential to keep equipment running.
examples.zh: 在早期的工厂里，润滑工对设备运转至关重要。

definition.en: (slang, historical) a working-class teenager or young man in the 1950s–60s (especially in the U.S.) known for slick, greased-back hair, leather jackets, and a rebellious style
definition.zh: （俚语，历史用法）20世纪50–60年代（尤指美国）以“抹发油背头”、皮夹克和叛逆风格著称的工人阶层青年（常译作“油头青年”）

examples.en: In the movie, the greasers hang out near the diner after school.
examples.zh: 电影里，那些“油头青年”放学后常在餐馆附近闲逛。

examples.en: He dressed like a 1950s greaser, with a leather jacket and slick hair.
examples.zh: 他打扮得像50年代的油头青年：皮夹克加油亮的背头。

definition.en: (offensive, U.S. slang) a racial slur for a Mexican or other Latino person
definition.zh: （冒犯性用语，美国俚语）对墨西哥人或其他拉丁裔的种族歧视性辱称

examples.en: Do not use that word—it is an offensive slur.
examples.zh: 不要用那个词——那是带有歧视性的侮辱。

examples.en: The school disciplined students for using racist slurs, including “greaser.”
examples.zh: 学校因学生使用包括“greaser”在内的种族辱称而进行处分。

extraExplanation: “Greaser”作为“油头青年”常出现在美国流行文化中，比如《The Outsiders》（《局外人》）里“Greasers vs. Socs”的阶层对立设定；在这种语境下，它更多指一种青少年亚文化和社会阶层形象。
但“greaser”也曾被用作针对墨西哥人/拉丁裔的辱称，带有强烈歧视色彩；在现实交流中应避免使用。阅读历史文本时若遇到该词，需要根据上下文判断是“亚文化称呼”还是“种族辱称”。

summary.en: “Greasers” is the plural of “greaser”: most commonly, a 1950s-style working-class youth with slicked hair (e.g., in *The Outsiders*); it can also mean a machine-lubrication worker, and it has an offensive slang sense for Latinos.
summary.zh: “Greasers”是“greaser”的复数：最常见指梳油头的20世纪50年代工人阶层青少年形象（如《局外人》）；也可指给机器上油的工人；另有针对拉丁裔的冒犯性贬称含义。

definition.en: A person (often a young man) whose hairstyle and fashion involve slicked-back, “greasy” hair; in American pop culture, especially a working‑class teen associated with 1950s-style street culture (e.g., in S. E. Hinton’s novel *The Outsiders*).
definition.zh: （常指年轻男性）把头发抹油梳成背头、穿着特定风格的人；在美国流行文化中尤指与20世纪50年代街头/工人阶层青少年文化相关的“greaser”（如小说《局外人 The Outsiders》中的团体）。

examples.en: In *The Outsiders*, the Greasers and the Socs come from different social classes.
examples.zh: 在《局外人》中，“Greasers”和“Socs”来自不同的社会阶层。

examples.en: He dressed like a greaser, with slicked-back hair and a leather jacket.
examples.zh: 他打扮得像个“greaser”，头发向后梳得油亮，还穿着皮夹克。

definition.en: A worker who applies grease or oil to machines; a mechanic or maintenance worker who lubricates equipment.
definition.zh: 给机器上油/涂润滑脂的工人；（设备）润滑维护人员。

examples.en: The factory hired a greaser to keep the conveyor belts running smoothly.
examples.zh: 工厂雇了一名润滑工来保证传送带运转顺畅。

examples.en: The greasers checked the bearings every morning.
examples.zh: 润滑工每天早上检查轴承。

definition.en: (Offensive slang) A derogatory term for a Latino/Hispanic person.
definition.zh: （冒犯性俚语）对拉丁裔/西语裔的贬称。

examples.en: That word is offensive; don’t use it.
examples.zh: 那个词带有侮辱性，不要使用。

extraExplanation: “greaser(s)”在不同语境里差异很大：在文学/电影或复古文化里常指一种青少年亚文化形象（比如《The Outsiders》）；但它也曾被用作针对拉丁裔的侮辱性称呼。现实交流中如果不是在明确讨论作品或历史语境，建议避免用来称呼人，以免造成冒犯。

summary.en: “Greases” is the plural of grease (oil/fat, lubricant) and also the third-person singular form of the verb “grease” (to lubricate or to make oily/dirty).
summary.zh: “Greases”既是名词 grease 的复数（油脂/润滑脂），也是动词 “grease”的第三人称单数（润滑；把……弄油腻/弄脏）。

definition.en: (plural) fats or oily substances used for cooking or for lubricating machines.
definition.zh: （复数）油脂；（用于烹饪或润滑机器的）润滑脂、油膏。

examples.en: The mechanic wiped old greases off the engine parts.
examples.zh: 修理工把发动机零件上的旧油脂擦掉。

examples.en: Different greases are used for different temperatures.
examples.zh: 不同的润滑脂适用于不同的温度。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “grease”) to put grease on something so it moves smoothly; to lubricate.
definition.zh: （动词 grease 的第三人称单数）给……上油脂以便更顺畅；润滑。

examples.en: He greases the bike chain every month.
examples.zh: 他每个月都会给自行车链条上油。

examples.en: The technician greases the bearings to reduce noise.
examples.zh: 技术员给轴承上润滑脂以降低噪音。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “grease”) to make something dirty or oily, often accidentally.
definition.zh: （动词 grease 的第三人称单数）把……弄得油腻/弄脏（常为不小心）。

examples.en: The sauce greases the paper bag.
examples.zh: 酱汁把纸袋弄得油腻。

examples.en: Working in the kitchen often greases your hands.
examples.zh: 在厨房干活常常会把手弄得油腻。

extraExplanation: “grease”在美式英语中常指较“厚”的油脂或润滑脂；“oil”更常指较“稀”的油（如食用油或机油）。因此机器保养里常说“use grease for bearings（轴承用润滑脂）”。

summary.en: Greasewood is a desert shrub, common in salty soils of the western U.S.
summary.zh: Greasewood 指一种常见于美国西部盐碱荒漠地带的灌木。

definition.en: a shrub that grows in dry, salty soils, especially in the western U.S. (often referring to the plant Sarcobatus vermiculatus), with oily/waxy leaves
definition.zh: 一种生长在干燥、盐碱土壤中的灌木，尤指美国西部常见的“油木/油灌木”（常指Sarcobatus vermiculatus），叶片常带油脂或蜡质感

examples.en: Greasewood often grows near salty flats and desert wetlands.
examples.zh: 油木常生长在盐碱地和沙漠湿地附近。

examples.en: The trail crossed a plain dotted with greasewood and sagebrush.
examples.zh: 小路穿过一片点缀着油木和蒿属灌木的平原。

extraExplanation: “greasewood”是北美荒漠与半荒漠地区常见的植被名称，带有明显的地域色彩；在自然写作与西部题材文学里，它常用来营造“干燥、风大、盐碱地”的景象。
词中“grease-”并不是说它真的用来做油脂，而是形容叶面或枝条常显得油亮、带蜡质。

summary.en: “Greasier” is the comparative form of “greasy,” meaning more oily/slippery, or (informally) more sleazy/insincerely flattering.
summary.zh: “greasier”是“greasy”的比较级，表示更油腻/更滑；口语中也可指更油滑、谄媚虚伪、让人反感。

definition.en: More covered with grease or oil; more slippery or oily.
definition.zh: 更油腻的；更沾油的；更滑的。

examples.en: This pan is greasier than the one we used yesterday.
examples.zh: 这个锅比我们昨天用的更油腻。

examples.en: After the pizza, my hands felt even greasier.
examples.zh: 吃完披萨后，我的手感觉更油了。

definition.en: More unpleasantly flattering, insincere, or sleazy in style or behavior (informal).
definition.zh: （非正式）更油滑的；更谄媚虚伪的；更让人反感的（举止/风格）。

examples.en: His compliments got greasier as he tried to get a favor.
examples.zh: 他想求帮忙时，恭维话变得更油滑了。

examples.en: That ad feels greasier than the old one—too pushy and fake.
examples.zh: 这个广告比旧的更“油”，太咄咄逼人又很假。

extraExplanation: “greasier”是形容词“greasy”的比较级（greasy → greasier → greasiest）。字面意思和食物/油脂有关；引申义常用来形容说话做事让人不舒服的“油腻”“油滑”，语气偏负面，属于口语表达。

summary.en: “Greasiest” means the most oily/fatty; informally it can also mean the most sleazy or unpleasantly flattering.
summary.zh: “greasiest”表示“最油的/油脂最多的”；口语中也可指“最油腻、最油滑/让人不舒服的奉承”。

definition.en: Superlative of “greasy”: having the most grease or oil; the most oily or fatty.
definition.zh: “greasy”的最高级：最油的；油脂最多的。

examples.en: Of all the fast-food options, the fried chicken is the greasiest.
examples.zh: 在所有快餐选择里，炸鸡是最油的。

examples.en: This is the greasiest part of the pan—wipe it again.
examples.zh: 锅里这一块最油——再擦一遍。

definition.en: (Informal, figurative) The most unpleasantly flattering, pushy, or “sleazy” in style or behavior.
definition.zh: （非正式，引申）最油腻的（指说话/行为让人不舒服的奉承、油滑、轻浮或“猥琐”风格）。

examples.en: He gave me the greasiest smile and tried to sell me something.
examples.zh: 他对我露出一种特别油腻的笑容，想推销东西。

examples.en: That was the greasiest compliment I’ve ever heard.
examples.zh: 那是我听过最油的恭维话。

extraExplanation: “greasiest”是形容词“greasy”的最高级：greasy → greasier → greasiest。拼写上通常把结尾的-y变成-i再加-er/est。

summary.en: “Greasily” means “in an oily/greasy way,” and it can also mean “in an unpleasantly flattering, insincere way.”
summary.zh: “greasily”表示“油腻地/带油地”，也可引申为“油滑地、谄媚而不真诚地”。

definition.en: In an oily or greasy way; covered with oil or fat, or making something oily.
definition.zh: 油腻地；带着油脂地；以使某物变得油腻的方式。

examples.en: He wiped his hands greasily on his jeans after eating fries.
examples.zh: 他吃完薯条后，把油腻的手随便在牛仔裤上擦了擦。

examples.en: The pan was greasily coated with old cooking oil.
examples.zh: 锅上覆着一层油腻的旧食用油。

definition.en: In a way that seems unpleasantly flattering or insincere (often about someone’s voice, smile, or manner).
definition.zh: （带贬义）油滑地；谄媚而不真诚地（常形容说话、微笑或举止）。

examples.en: "Anything for you," he said greasily, with a forced smile.
examples.zh: “只要你开口，什么都行。”他油滑地说着，挤出一个假笑。

examples.en: She disliked the way he spoke so greasily to customers.
examples.zh: 她不喜欢他对顾客说话那种油滑的腔调。

extraExplanation: “greasily”来自形容词“greasy（油腻的/油滑的）”。它既可以是字面意义（真的有油），也可以是比喻意义（让人不舒服的奉承、虚伪）。在写作里，用来营造“黏腻、令人反感”的感觉很常见。
近义词区分：表示“油腻地”可用“oily”；表示“谄媚地”更常见的是“sleazily（下流/令人反感地）”“obsequiously（卑躬屈膝地）”。“greasily”在比喻义上语气通常偏负面。

summary.en: Greasiness means an oily quality or feeling, and informally it can mean a sleazy, unpleasant vibe.
summary.zh: Greasiness 指“油腻感/油脂感”，口语中也可指“油滑猥琐、让人反感的气质”。

definition.en: the quality of being oily or covered with grease; an oily feel or look
definition.zh: 油腻、带油脂的特性；油油的触感或外观

examples.en: This sunscreen leaves a greasiness on my skin.
examples.zh: 这款防晒会在我皮肤上留下油腻感。

examples.en: I don’t like the greasiness of fast food.
examples.zh: 我不喜欢快餐的油腻感。

definition.en: informal: an unpleasant “sleazy” or morally questionable quality in someone’s behavior or style
definition.zh: 非正式：令人不舒服的“油滑/猥琐”气质；让人觉得不正派或不可靠的感觉

examples.en: There was a greasiness to the way he kept staring at her.
examples.zh: 他一直盯着她看的方式让人感觉很油腻、很不舒服。

examples.en: The ad has a kind of greasiness that makes people distrust it.
examples.zh: 这则广告有种油滑感，让人不太信任。

extraExplanation: greasiness 来自 grease（油脂、润滑油）。字面上指“油腻”，在口语里也可引申为“让人反感的油滑/轻浮/不正派气息”。注意它通常带有负面评价：食物太油、头发太油，或某人的举止让人不舒服。
常见搭配：skin/scalp greasiness（皮肤/头皮出油）、reduce greasiness（减少油腻/控油）、greasiness on the surface（表面油膜/油腻感）。

summary.en: “Greasing” usually means applying grease/oil for lubrication or maintenance; informally it can also mean bribing (often “greasing someone’s palm”).
summary.zh: “Greasing”通常指给物体上油/润滑或进行保养；非正式用法中也可指行贿（常见于“greasing someone’s palm”）。

definition.en: (present participle of “grease”) putting grease or oil on something so it moves smoothly or doesn’t stick.
definition.zh: （“grease”的现在分词）给某物涂抹油脂/润滑油，使其运转顺畅或防粘。

examples.en: He is greasing the bicycle chain.
examples.zh: 他正在给自行车链条上油。

examples.en: Greasing the pan will keep the cake from sticking.
examples.zh: 给烤盘抹油可以防止蛋糕粘住。

definition.en: The act or process of applying grease or oil (often for maintenance).
definition.zh: 上油/涂抹油脂的行为或过程（常用于保养维护）。

examples.en: Regular greasing helps the machine run quietly.
examples.zh: 定期上油能让机器运行更安静。

examples.en: The manual recommends weekly greasing of the joints.
examples.zh: 说明书建议每周给接头上油。

definition.en: (informal, usually in the phrase “greasing someone’s palm”) giving money or gifts as a bribe to get help or special treatment.
definition.zh: （非正式，常见于短语“greasing someone’s palm”）用钱或礼物行贿，以获得帮助或特殊照顾。

examples.en: He got the permit quickly by greasing someone’s palm.
examples.zh: 他通过行贿很快就拿到了许可证。

examples.en: The report accused the company of greasing officials.
examples.zh: 报告指控该公司向官员行贿。

extraExplanation: “Greasing someone’s palm(s)”是英语里常见的比喻说法：把“抹油让东西更顺滑”借来形容“用贿赂让事情更好办”。在正式写作中应避免使用或改用更直接的词（如 bribery / bribe）。

summary.en: Greasy means oily or unpleasantly oily/dirty; informally it can describe someone’s sleazy, insincere charm.
summary.zh: Greasy 指“油腻的/满是油的”，也可指“脏黏（因油或汗）”；口语里还能形容人“油滑、猥琐、不真诚”。

definition.en: Covered with, containing, or tasting like oil or fat; oily (often unpleasant).
definition.zh: 油腻的；满是油脂的（常带有不舒服或不健康的感觉）。

examples.en: The pizza was delicious, but a little greasy.
examples.zh: 这披萨很好吃，但有点油腻。

examples.en: Use a paper towel to wipe the greasy pan.
examples.zh: 用纸巾把油腻的锅擦一擦。

definition.en: Unpleasantly dirty or slimy, often because of oil or sweat.
definition.zh: （因油污或汗渍而）脏兮兮的；黏腻的。

examples.en: After working in the garage, his hands were greasy.
examples.zh: 在车库干完活后，他的手脏得油腻腻的。

examples.en: Her hair felt greasy after a long day.
examples.zh: 忙了一整天后，她的头发摸起来很油。

definition.en: Informal: showing cheap or pushy charm in a way that feels dishonest; sleazy.
definition.zh: 【非正式】油滑的；谄媚讨好但让人觉得不真诚的；猥琐的。

examples.en: He gave me a greasy smile that made me uncomfortable.
examples.zh: 他对我露出一个油滑的笑，让我很不舒服。

examples.en: The salesman’s greasy talk made her walk away.
examples.zh: 那推销员油腔滑调，她转身就走了。

extraExplanation: “greasy”既可描述食物和物体上的“油”，也常形容头发/皮肤“出油”。在口语里形容人时（greasy smile / greasy guy）带明显贬义，接近“油腻、猥琐、油滑”，使用时注意场合与礼貌。
常见搭配：greasy food（油腻食物）, greasy hair（油头）, greasy hands（油手/脏手）, greasy spoon（【美式口语】便宜的小餐馆/简餐店，常卖油煎食物）。

summary.en: A “greasy spoon” is a cheap, no-frills diner serving simple comfort food (often breakfast).
summary.zh: “greasy spoon”指便宜朴实、不讲究的小餐馆，常卖简单的家常餐（尤其早餐）。

definition.en: a small, inexpensive diner (often slightly run-down) that serves simple, hearty food, especially breakfast and coffee
definition.zh: （常带点破旧感的）廉价小餐馆/小饭馆，主打简单、量足的家常餐，尤其是早餐和咖啡

examples.en: We grabbed pancakes at a greasy spoon near the bus station.
examples.zh: 我们在汽车站附近的一家小饭馆吃了煎饼。

examples.en: He loves greasy spoons because the coffee is cheap and the portions are big.
examples.zh: 他喜欢这种廉价小餐馆，因为咖啡便宜、分量又大。

examples.en: It’s not fancy, but that greasy spoon makes the best bacon and eggs.
examples.zh: 虽然不高级，但那家小饭馆的培根煎蛋最好吃。

extraExplanation: 这是比较口语、带一点“嫌弃但亲切”的说法：greasy 暗示油腻、环境不讲究；spoon 代表用餐场景。通常并非正式贬义，更像是在说“朴实、接地气、好吃不贵”。
常见搭配：a greasy spoon diner / local greasy spoon / hole-in-the-wall greasy spoon（很不起眼的小店）。
在英美影视与小说里常出现为“街角餐馆”的意象：深夜、咖啡续杯、熟客聊天、服务员记得你常点什么等，常用来营造市井与温情的氛围。

summary.en: “Great” most commonly means “excellent,” and it can also mean “large” or “important/famous.” It’s also used as an informal response meaning “good/okay!”
summary.zh: “great”最常见是“很棒/极好”，也可表示“很大/很多”或“重要/伟大”，还可作口语感叹词表示“好呀/太好了”。

definition.en: Very good; excellent; of high quality.
definition.zh: 很好的；极好的；高质量的。

examples.en: You did a great job on the presentation.
examples.zh: 你的展示做得非常棒。

examples.en: That restaurant has great food.
examples.zh: 那家餐厅的食物很赞。

definition.en: Large in amount, size, or degree.
definition.zh: 大量的；巨大的；程度很高的。

examples.en: There was a great difference between the two plans.
examples.zh: 这两个方案之间有很大的差别。

examples.en: She felt great pressure to succeed.
examples.zh: 她感到成功的压力很大。

definition.en: Important or famous.
definition.zh: 重要的；著名的；伟大的。

examples.en: He is one of the great writers of the 20th century.
examples.zh: 他是20世纪最伟大的作家之一。

definition.en: Used to say you approve, agree, or that something is acceptable (informal).
definition.zh: （非正式）用于表示赞同、认可或“可以/没问题”。

examples.en: —Can we meet at 3? —Great!
examples.zh: ——我们三点见可以吗？——太好了！

extraExplanation: “great”在日常口语里常常相当于“nice/awesome/okay”，语气取决于语境：真心赞美时是积极的；但在某些场合也可能带一点敷衍或讽刺（比如听到坏消息时说“Great.”）。
常见搭配：great idea（好主意）、great time（玩得很开心）、a great deal of（大量的）、the Great Lakes（五大湖，专有名词要大写）。

summary.en: A greatcoat is a long, heavy overcoat, often associated with older styles or military uniforms.
summary.zh: greatcoat 指厚重的长大衣，常与旧式穿着或军装联系在一起。

definition.en: a long, heavy coat worn over other clothes, especially in cold weather (often part of a uniform in the past)
definition.zh: （尤指旧时制服的一部分）大衣；厚长外套，通常穿在其他衣服外面御寒

examples.en: The soldier buttoned his greatcoat against the wind.
examples.zh: 士兵把大衣扣好来抵御寒风。

examples.en: He hung his greatcoat by the door and came inside.
examples.zh: 他把大衣挂在门旁，然后走了进来。

examples.en: In old photographs, many men are wearing greatcoats and hats.
examples.zh: 在老照片里，很多男性都穿着大衣、戴着帽子。

extraExplanation: “greatcoat”常见于历史语境，尤其与19—20世纪的军装或正式外套有关；现代日常英语里更常用“overcoat”或“coat”。
在文学与历史题材中，“greatcoat”常用来营造寒冷、战争或旧时代的氛围（例如描写士兵、旅人、维多利亚时代街景等）。

summary.en: Greatcoated means “wearing a thick, long overcoat (a greatcoat).”
summary.zh: greatcoated 意为“穿着厚重的长大衣（greatcoat）”。

definition.en: Wearing a greatcoat (a thick, long overcoat), often for cold weather.
definition.zh: 穿着大衣（厚实的长外套，常用于御寒）。

examples.en: A greatcoated soldier stood guard by the gate.
examples.zh: 一名穿着大衣的士兵站在门口站岗。

examples.en: We saw a greatcoated figure walking through the fog.
examples.zh: 我们看见一个穿大衣的身影在雾中行走。

extraExplanation: “greatcoat”在英式语境里更常见，指19世纪到20世纪常见的厚重长外套，常与军装、冬季旅行或老电影里的形象相关。现代日常英语中更常说“overcoat”或“coat”，因此“greatcoated”多见于描写性写作、历史题材或文学语境。

summary.en: A greatcoat is a long, heavy overcoat, often associated with older military or historical clothing.
summary.zh: greatcoat 指厚重的长大衣，常与旧时军装或历史场景相关。

definition.en: a long, heavy overcoat worn in cold weather, especially in the past (often by soldiers)
definition.zh: （尤指旧时或军人穿的）厚重的长大衣、军大衣

examples.en: He pulled on a greatcoat before stepping into the snow.
examples.zh: 他出门踏入雪地前穿上了一件军大衣。

examples.en: In the old photograph, the soldiers are standing in greatcoats.
examples.zh: 在那张老照片里，士兵们穿着军大衣站着。

examples.en: She bought a vintage greatcoat at a secondhand shop.
examples.zh: 她在二手店买了一件复古的军大衣。

extraExplanation: “greatcoat”常见于19世纪到20世纪前期的欧洲语境，尤其与军队制服有关：它通常很长、很厚，有时带肩章或披肩式设计，用来在寒冷与风雨中保暖。现代日常英语更常说“overcoat”或“coat”，但在历史小说、战争题材作品里“greatcoat”很常见。

summary.en: “Greaten” means to make something greater (increase/enhance), or less commonly to become greater.
summary.zh: “Greaten”指使某事物变得更大/更强/更重要（增加、增强）；较少用作“变得更大/更强”。

definition.en: to make something bigger, stronger, more important, or more intense; to increase or enhance
definition.zh: 使变大、变强、更重要或更激烈；加强、增大

examples.en: The new highway will greatly greaten trade between the two cities.
examples.zh: 这条新高速公路将大大促进两座城市之间的贸易。

examples.en: Her success only greatened his determination to work harder.
examples.zh: 她的成功反而更增强了他努力工作的决心。

examples.en: Small daily habits can greaten your confidence over time.
examples.zh: 每天的小习惯能随着时间增强你的自信。

definition.en: (less common) to become greater or more intense
definition.zh: （较少用）变得更大或更强烈

examples.en: As the storm greatened, the wind shook the windows.
examples.zh: 风暴愈发猛烈时，狂风把窗户都震得摇晃。

extraExplanation: “greaten”来自形容词“great（大的；伟大的）”加动词后缀“-en”（表示“使……变得……”或“变得……”），类似的词还有“widen（使变宽）”“strengthen（加强）”。在现代英语里，“increase / enlarge / enhance / strengthen”更常用，“greaten”显得偏正式或略带文学色彩。

summary.en: “Greatened” is a rare past form of “greaten,” meaning “made greater or more intense.”
summary.zh: “greatened”是罕见的过去式/过去分词，表示“使更大/更强烈、加剧”。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of “greaten”) to make something greater, larger, more important, or more intense.
definition.zh: （动词 greaten 的过去式/过去分词）使某物更大、更重要或更强烈；加强。

examples.en: The crisis greatened public anxiety overnight.
examples.zh: 这场危机一夜之间加剧了公众的焦虑。

examples.en: Her success greatened his determination to work harder.
examples.zh: 她的成功增强了他更努力工作的决心。

extraExplanation: “greaten / greatened”在现代英语中非常少见，很多情况下更自然的说法是用 make…greater、increase、strengthen、intensify 等。
在文学或较旧的文本里可能会见到“greatened”来表达“加剧/增大”的效果，但在日常写作中使用会显得古旧或不地道。

summary.en: Greatening means making something greater or becoming greater (rare; from the verb greaten).
summary.zh: Greatening 指“使……变得更大/更重要/更强”或“变得更大”（较少见，源自动词 greaten）。

definition.en: (Present participle of **greaten**) making something greater in size, importance, power, or degree; strengthening or enlarging.
definition.zh: （**greaten** 的现在分词）使某物变得更大、更重要、更强或程度更高；增强、扩大。

examples.en: The new policy is **greatening** the gap between rich and poor.
examples.zh: 这项新政策正在**扩大**贫富差距。

examples.en: They invested in education, **greatening** the city’s long-term potential.
examples.zh: 他们投资教育，**提升/扩大**了这座城市的长期潜力。

definition.en: The act or process of becoming greater; an increase (rare).
definition.zh: 变得更大/更强的过程；增长（较少见）。

examples.en: We can see a **greatening** of public interest in renewable energy.
examples.zh: 我们可以看到公众对可再生能源的兴趣在**增长**。

extraExplanation: “greatening”本身不算常用词；现代英语里更常用 **increasing, enlarging, strengthening, expanding** 等。
动词 **greaten** 带有较文学或较正式的色彩，常见于修辞性表达（如“greaten one’s influence/importance”）。

summary.en: “Greatens” means “makes something greater” (or, less commonly, “becomes greater”). It is the third-person singular form of “greaten.”
summary.zh: “greatens”表示“使……更大/更强/更重要”（较少见也可指“变得更大”），是动词“greaten”的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: to make something greater in size, importance, strength, or degree; to enlarge or intensify
definition.zh: 使某物变得更大、更重要、更强或程度更高；扩大；增强

examples.en: The new evidence greatens the importance of the case.
examples.zh: 新的证据增强了这个案件的重要性。

examples.en: Hardship can greaten a person’s determination.
examples.zh: 艰难困苦可能会增强一个人的决心。

definition.en: (less common) to become greater; to increase
definition.zh: （不常用）变得更大/更强；增加

examples.en: As the storm moved closer, the danger seemed to greaten.
examples.zh: 暴风雨越靠近，危险似乎越大。

extraExplanation: “greatens”是动词“greaten”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it greatens）。这个词在现代英语里比较少见，很多情况下更常用“increase / enlarge / intensify / heighten”。不过在较文学或较正式的表达中仍可能出现。

summary.en: “Greater” is the comparative form of “great,” meaning larger or more important; it’s also used in place names (e.g., Greater London) and for comparisons like “greater than.”
summary.zh: “Greater”是“great”的比较级，表示更大/更多/更重要；也常用于地名（如大伦敦）以及“greater than”（大于/超过）等比较表达。

definition.en: Larger in size, amount, number, degree, or importance.
definition.zh: 更大的；更多的；更重要的（用于比较两者）

examples.en: This box is greater than that one.
examples.zh: 这个箱子比那个更大。

examples.en: The greater the effort, the greater the reward.
examples.zh: 付出越多，回报越大。

examples.en: We need greater attention to safety.
examples.zh: 我们需要更加重视安全。

definition.en: Used to refer to the main or larger part of a place or group (often in names).
definition.zh: （用于地名或群体名称）大…的；主要部分的

examples.en: Greater Los Angeles includes many surrounding cities.
examples.zh: 大洛杉矶地区包括许多周边城市。

examples.en: They work in the Greater Bay Area.
examples.zh: 他们在大湾区工作。

definition.en: A larger number or majority (usually with “the”).
definition.zh: （通常与 the 连用）较大数量；大多数

examples.en: The greater of the two numbers is 12.
examples.zh: 两个数中较大的是12。

examples.en: The greater part of the budget goes to housing.
examples.zh: 预算的大部分用于住房。

definition.en: More than; beyond (in comparisons, often in math or measurement).
definition.zh: 大于；超过（常用于数学或量的比较）

examples.en: Ten is greater than eight.
The temperature rose to greater than 100°F.
examples.zh: 气温升到超过100华氏度。

extraExplanation: “greater”是“great”的比较级，常见搭配有：greater than（比…更…/大于…）、the greater good（更大的公益/整体利益）、the greater part（大部分）。
句型“The + 比较级…, the + 比较级…”表示“越…就越…”，如：The greater the risk, the greater the reward（风险越大，回报越高）。

summary.en: “Greatest” usually means “the best / most excellent” or “the highest degree of something.” It can also mean famous top people (“the greats”).
summary.zh: “greatest”通常表示“最优秀/最好的”或“最大程度的”。也可作名词，指某领域的“大师/名家”（the greats）。

definition.en: The best or most excellent in a group; of the highest level, importance, or degree.
definition.zh: 最好的；最优秀的；最高程度的。

examples.en: She is one of the greatest tennis players of all time.
examples.zh: 她是史上最伟大的网球选手之一。

examples.en: This may be the greatest challenge we’ve ever faced.
examples.zh: 这可能是我们遇到过的最大挑战。

examples.en: My greatest hope is that everyone stays safe.
examples.zh: 我最大的希望是大家都平安。

definition.en: A superlative form of “great,” used to compare three or more things/people.
definition.zh: “great”的最高级，用于三者或以上的比较。

examples.en: Of the three options, this is the greatest value for the money.
examples.zh: 在这三个选项中，这个最划算。

examples.en: Who is the greatest singer in your opinion?
examples.zh: 你认为谁是最伟大的歌手？

definition.en: A very famous or highly respected person (often used with “the,” as in “the greats”).
definition.zh: 名人；大师（常用the greats表示“伟人/大师们”）。

examples.en: He studied the techniques of the greats before developing his own style.
examples.zh: 他先研究大师们的技法，然后形成了自己的风格。

examples.en: This award is given only to the greats of the sport.
examples.zh: 这个奖只颁给这项运动中的顶尖人物。

extraExplanation:
“greatest”常见于固定搭配：
- the greatest of all time（史上最伟大，常缩写为 GOAT）
- my/your/their greatest + 名词（“最大的……”：greatest fear/joy/concern）
- the greats（某领域的“巨匠/名家”集合说法）

拼写与用法提示：great → greater → greatest（规则最高级）。在正式写作中，比较对象要清楚：the greatest *in the class / of the three / of all time*。

summary.en: “Greathead” is usually a surname; in engineering it also appears in the term “Greathead shield,” an early tunneling technology.
summary.zh: “Greathead”多為姓氏；在工程語境中也常見於 “Greathead shield（Greathead 盾構）”，指早期的隧道掘進技術。

definition.en: a family name (surname), most often seen as a proper noun in English.
definition.zh: （英語）姓氏（專有名詞），常見於人名。

examples.en: Ms. Greathead works in our accounting department.
examples.zh: Greathead 女士在我們的會計部門工作。

examples.en: I found a paper by Greathead in the archives.
examples.zh: 我在檔案裡找到一篇署名 Greathead 的論文。

definition.en: (in engineering) used in the name of the “Greathead shield,” an early tunneling machine design.
definition.zh: （工程）用於「Greathead 盾構／隧道掘進盾」等名稱，指一種早期隧道掘進設備的設計。

examples.en: The lecture mentioned the Greathead shield as a key step in modern tunneling.
examples.zh: 講座提到 Greathead 盾構是現代隧道工程的重要一步。

examples.en: Engineers improved on Greathead’s design to build safer underground lines.
examples.zh: 工程師在 Greathead 的設計基礎上改良，修建更安全的地下線路。

extraExplanation: Greathead 常指英國工程師 James Henry Greathead（1844–1896）。他改良了隧道掘進盾構技術，對早期倫敦地下鐵與後來的盾構隧道施工有影響。這就是為什麼在工程語境中會看到 Greathead shield（Greathead 盾構）這個說法。

summary.en: “Greatheart” means a brave, noble, kind-hearted person; it can also be a literary name/title for a heroic figure.
summary.zh: “greatheart”指勇敢高尚、心地善良的人；也可作文学中英雄人物的名字/称号。

definition.en: A brave, noble, and kind-hearted person; someone with great courage and generosity.
definition.zh: 勇敢高尚、心地善良的人；有非凡勇气与慷慨精神的人。

examples.en: Everyone called the firefighter a greatheart after the rescue.
examples.zh: 救援之后，大家都称那位消防员是个“勇者”。

examples.en: She’s a greatheart—she helps others even when no one is watching.
examples.zh: 她是个“侠义之人”——即使没人注意，她也会帮助别人。

definition.en: A name or title used for a heroic figure (sometimes as a proper name), especially in literature.
definition.zh: 用作英雄人物的名字或称号（有时为专有名词），尤见于文学作品中。

examples.en: In some retellings, Greatheart is portrayed as a guide who protects travelers on their journey.
examples.zh: 在一些改写版本中，Greatheart被塑造成在旅途中保护行者的向导。

extraExplanation: “Greatheart”在英语里常带有文学色彩：它既可作普通名词，意为“勇者/义士”，也常让人联想到约翰·班扬（John Bunyan）的《天路历程》（The Pilgrim’s Progress）中的角色“Great-heart”（大心/大勇者），象征勇气、护卫与道德力量。
拼写上也可能见到连字符形式“Great-heart”，或在文学语境中作为专名首字母大写“Greatheart”。

summary.en: Greathearted means kind, generous, and noble (sometimes also brave and high-minded).
summary.zh: greathearted 指善良慷慨、品格高尚（有时也含勇敢、志向高远）。

definition.en: Kind, generous, and noble in character; having a big-hearted spirit.
definition.zh: 心地善良、慷慨而高尚的；胸怀宽广的。

examples.en: She was greathearted and quietly helped her neighbors when they were struggling.
examples.zh: 她很宽厚善良，在邻居困难时默默伸出援手。

examples.en: A greathearted leader listens with respect, even to people who disagree.
examples.zh: 一个胸怀宽广的领导者会尊重地倾听，即使对方持不同意见。

definition.en: Brave and high-minded; showing moral courage.
definition.zh: 勇敢而有崇高志向的；表现出道德勇气的。

examples.en: In the story, the hero makes a greathearted choice and protects the weak.
examples.zh: 在故事里，英雄做出勇敢高尚的选择，保护弱者。

extraExplanation: “greathearted”是由 great（伟大的）+ hearted（有……心肠的）构成的复合形容词，语感偏文学/书面，有时带一点古典气息。日常口语里更常见的表达是 “big-hearted”“kind-hearted” 或 “generous”。

summary.en: “Greatheartedly” means doing or responding in a generous, kind, noble way.
summary.zh: “greatheartedly”表示以宽宏、善良而高尚的方式行事或回应。

definition.en: in a generous, kind, and noble way; with a big heart (showing warmth, courage, and readiness to help others).
definition.zh: 以宽宏、善良而高尚的方式；以大度之心（表现出温暖、勇气与乐于助人）。

examples.en: She accepted the criticism greatheartedly and thanked everyone for their honesty.
examples.zh: 她以宽宏的态度接受了批评，并感谢大家的坦诚。

examples.en: The community greatheartedly welcomed the new families after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，社区以热情而慷慨的方式欢迎新来的家庭。

examples.en: He spoke greatheartedly about his rival, praising their hard work.
examples.zh: 他以宽厚的口吻谈到对手，称赞对方的努力。

extraExplanation: “greatheartedly”由形容词“great-hearted（宽厚的、仁慈的）”加副词后缀“-ly”构成，但在现代英语中相对少见。更常见、更自然的表达包括“generously / kindly / magnanimously / with a big heart”。在写作中使用它会带一点文学或修辞色彩，强调“心胸宽广、品格高尚”的感觉。

summary.en: Greatheartedness means a generous, noble, big-hearted spirit.
summary.zh: greatheartedness 指慷慨仁慈、气度宏大的“伟大胸怀”。

definition.en: The quality of being very kind, generous, and noble in spirit; big-heartedness.
definition.zh: 伟大的胸怀；宽厚仁慈；慷慨高尚的品格（指心地善良、乐于助人、气度宏大）。

examples.en: Her greatheartedness showed in the way she forgave people and helped them start again.
examples.zh: 她的伟大胸怀体现在：她愿意原谅别人，并帮助他们重新开始。

examples.en: In the story, the hero’s greatheartedness is more powerful than his strength.
examples.zh: 在这个故事里，英雄的伟大胸怀比他的力量更有影响力。

examples.en: The community remembered him for his greatheartedness toward strangers.
examples.zh: 社区因他对陌生人的宽厚与善意而记住了他。

extraExplanation: “greatheartedness”由 great-hearted（宽厚的、仁慈慷慨的）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“……的特质/状态”）构成，强调的是一种持续的品格，而不只是一次性的善举。
这个词相对少见，日常英语里更常用的说法是 “generosity” 或 “kindness”；在文学或演讲中用 “greatheartedness” 会显得更庄重、更有赞美色彩。

summary.en: “Greatish” means “somewhat great” (informal), often implying “pretty good but not amazing.”
summary.zh: “greatish”表示“有点很棒/还不错”（非正式），常暗示“不错但不算特别惊艳”。

definition.en: Somewhat great; fairly good or impressive, but not truly great. (Informal)
definition.zh: 有点很棒；还不错、挺厉害，但还没到“非常棒/伟大”的程度。（非正式）

examples.en: The movie was greatish—fun to watch, but not amazing.
examples.zh: 这部电影还不错——看着挺有趣，但谈不上惊艳。

examples.en: My weekend was greatish; I got to rest, but I still had some work.
examples.zh: 我的周末算挺不错的；休息到了，但还是做了一些工作。

definition.en: Fairly large; kind of big. (Informal, less common)
definition.zh: 比较大；有点偏大。（非正式，较少见）

examples.en: We need a greatish table to fit everyone.
examples.zh: 我们需要一张比较大的桌子，才能坐得下所有人。

extraExplanation: “greatish”由“great + -ish”构成，-ish 常表示“有点……、大概……、差不多……”，语气会把程度变弱，也带一点随意甚至轻微保留态度。
口语里它常用来表达“还行、不错但不至于满分”的感觉；写正式文章时更建议用“quite good / fairly good / reasonably good”等。

summary.en: “Greatly” is an adverb meaning “very much” or “to a large degree,” often used in polite or formal writing.
summary.zh: “Greatly”是副词，表示“非常/在很大程度上”，常用于较正式或礼貌的表达。

definition.en: to a large degree; very much
definition.zh: 在很大程度上；非常

examples.en: Your help greatly improved my English.
examples.zh: 你的帮助极大地提升了我的英语。

examples.en: I would greatly appreciate it if you could reply today.
examples.zh: 如果你今天能回复，我将非常感激。

definition.en: by a great amount; significantly (often used with change or difference)
definition.zh: 大幅度地；显著地（常用于变化或差异）

examples.en: Prices have greatly increased since last year.
examples.zh: 自去年以来，价格大幅上涨。

examples.en: The final result greatly differs from our first plan.
examples.zh: 最终结果与我们的最初计划有很大不同。

extraExplanation: “greatly”是“great（很大的）+ -ly（副词后缀）”，常用于较正式的书面语或礼貌表达（如 greatly appreciate）。日常口语里更常用 “really / a lot / so much”。
常见搭配：greatly appreciate（非常感激）、greatly improve（大大提高）、greatly reduce（大幅减少）、greatly affect（极大影响）、greatly depend on（很大程度上取决于）、greatly increase/decrease（大幅增减）。

summary.en: “Greatmouthed” means loud, boastful, and given to exaggerated talk.
summary.zh: “greatmouthed”指说话夸张、自吹自擂、爱放大话。

definition.en: boastful and loud in speech; speaking in an exaggerated, bragging way
definition.zh: 夸口的；大话连篇的；说话夸张自吹的

examples.en: He made a greatmouthed promise that he could finish the whole project in one day.
examples.zh: 他夸下海口，说自己一天就能完成整个项目。

examples.en: The campaign was full of greatmouthed slogans but short on real plans.
examples.zh: 这次竞选充满了夸夸其谈的口号，却缺少真正的计划。

examples.en: Don’t trust greatmouthed talk—look for evidence.
examples.zh: 别轻信夸口的话——要看证据。

extraExplanation: “greatmouthed”也常写作“great-mouthed”。它由 great（大、很）+ mouthed（有……嘴的、说话方式的）构成，语气偏贬义，常见于较文学化或较老派的表达，用来批评一个人爱吹牛、言辞浮夸。

summary.en: Greatness means outstanding excellence or the high status/fame that comes from being recognized as great.
summary.zh: Greatness 指“卓越、伟大”，也可指因被公认为伟大而获得的显赫地位或盛名。

definition.en: The quality of being very good, important, or impressive; excellence on a high level.
definition.zh: 伟大；卓越；杰出（非常优秀、重要或令人钦佩的品质）

examples.en: She achieved greatness through years of hard work.
examples.zh: 她通过多年的努力取得了卓越的成就。

examples.en: The film captures the greatness of ordinary people in difficult times.
examples.zh: 这部电影展现了艰难时期普通人的伟大。
